plugins.name: 24Stream
plugins.description:
24Stream plugin helps to create rich-content for product cards, which is intended to be broadcasted to online sellers and marketplaces.

The plugin allows you to unify the layout and then automatically make the layout design in HTML, as well as to package in the E-package format - which is designed to exchange rich content between online sellers and marketplaces.

With the help of the plugin you can choose an existing design of the features, integrate it into your layout, make all necessary changes using the entire arsenal of Figma to work on layouts or create your own collection on the site with 24streamConverter and use it.

To convert your design to layout, you need to go to 24StreamConverter website, log in to your personal account via Figma and choose the necessary layout for conversion.

To access the plugin, you need to enter the key that you can get by writing to klimov@24ttl.ru.

plugins.name: 3Dconnexion SpaceMouse Driver
plugins.description:
Turn your 3Dconnexion SpaceMouse into a panning and zooming tool!
- Compatible with both wired and wireless models
- Intuitive spatial navigation
- Adjustable panning/zooming rate
- Invertable X/Y axes

Issues and contributions are welcome on GitHub
https://github.com/chuanqisun/figma-plugin-spacemouse

To learn more about the device, visit
https://www.3dconnexion.com/products/spacemouse.html

**Disclaimer**
I don't work for 3Dconnexion the company and I don't make any profit from making and maintaining this plugin. I'm a Human Computer Interaction (HCI) enthusiast making better tools for designers and developers alike.

plugins.name: A11y - Color Contrast Checker
plugins.description:
Ensure your text is readable for users by adhering to WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards. 

This plugin checks the color contrast ratio of all visible text in a frame, and it provides feedback on whether it meets WCAG‚Äôs AA and/or AAA level compliance. It also provides color sliders that allow users to adjust the colors and understand how the corresponding contrast ratio changes in real-time.

Currently only supports single, 100% solid fills. Working on some known issues with background layer detection (this is due to currently only supporting the aforementioned).

plugins.name: A11y - Focus Orderer
plugins.description:
Description

Quickly annotate your designs‚Äô focus / tab order flow. Why? Because not everyone uses a mouse cursor to navigate through online experiences; some people use the keyboard and/or other input devices -- so the flow of focused, interactable objects needs to be meaningful.


Features

  1. Bulk add, remove, reorder, and update annotations
  2. Keep all focus-order annotations in a single layer group that can be toggled on / off
  3. Load existing focus order annotation layers from previous sessions to resume editing
  4. Focus order embedded in metadata

plugins.name: Able ‚Äì Friction free accessibility
plugins.description:
Able makes accessibility easy, while looking and feeling like Figma! 
Add color contrast and color blindness to your workflow with as little effort as possible. Open Able and we will automatically compare the contrast between two layers you select. This way, you can keep Able open, and casually select layers to compare without re-running or updating the plugin!

ü§î Want to know more? We were recently featured in this brilliant article by Thomas Lowry. Check it out: https://www.figma.com/blog/design-for-everyone-with-these-accessibility-focused-plugins/

üëã You can also simulate different types of color blindness on your selected layers in the preview! 

üëã Copy the contrast ratio and scores and paste them into your color style descriptions as documentation!

Made by
Petter Iversen & Sondre Kvam

plugins.name: Above The Fold
plugins.description:
Make sure your most important elements will be visible every time on every device. Above the Fold plugin marks your designs with a layer that indicates where the above-the-fold portion ends.

üîåHow Above the Fold plugin works?

- Select one (or more) Artboard(s).
- Run the plugin with your desired target device.
- Your results * are ready

* The results are seperate layers on top of each Artboard.

‚ùì How can Above the Fold help me?

Above the Fold is the portion of a Web page that is visible in a browser window when the page first loads. Users engage more with the content above the fold than below the fold, thus key site functions and content related to business goals should appear at the top of the Web page.

üö® What is the Danger zone?

The viewport is the area where browsers load the web pages and >90% *  is different than the user's screen resolution. The browser and OS navigation bars add a dynamic offset to the final viewport. The danger zone represent the average difference in height between screen resolution and viewport.

*They are equal only when the web browser is in fullscreen mode

üêõWhere can I report bugs or suggest features?

Our Spectrum community is always open to your ideas:

https://spectrum.chat/visualeyes-designers/above-the-fold?tab=posts

plugins.name: ACSS
plugins.description:
Generate the text element to Html with CSS.

The plugin reads the text elements you select and let you export them into Html with CSS.

Three Tabs:
1. Generator: Text Elements => HTML+ CSS;
2. Setting: Give localName a cssName will render into the generator when matched;
3. Design Token: Help you to find all the local names defind in figma;

There are 2 way to use ACSS.

## Pure way:

This way you do not need setting, just open and generator.
The text styles blow will transform to the ACSS.

- `font-size`Ôºö ``.fs12{ font-size: 12px; }`...;
- `font-weight`Ôºö`.fw700{ font-weight: 700; }`...;
- `font-style`Ôºö`.fsi{ font-style: italic; }` ...;
- `line-height`Ôºö`.lh16{ line-height: 16px; }`...;
- `text-align`Ôºö`.tac{ text-align: center; }`...;
- `text-transform`Ôºö`.ttc{ text-transform: capitalize; }`...;

If the text with the `paragraphSpacing` will transform to the `margin-bottom`: `.mb16{ margin-bottom: 16px; }`...;

* ACSS„Äå Atomic css „Äç: Each css selector with only one css rules.

##  Custom way:

- You can give each local style name a alias as the css selecor in setting.
- When the generator match the rules, it will turn out to be the html and the CSS.
- Even you can custom different setting for different project.

The other stuff you don't give alias will use ACSS instead

## FAG

1. I can't open the plugin of ACSS in the first time?
Try 3 times and wait.

2. Why the default name in Design token with `g_` and `c_`?
- `g_`:  `global_`
- `c_`:  `color_`

3. How  to  ignore some local styles name?
Just set those style name with `_` start.
exp: `_Header`

4. I wanna knonw more about ACSS in code
https://nu-system.github.io/css/acss/

plugins.name: AD Compressor
plugins.description:
If you are designing and developing Google static banner ads, you must make sure all the image file sizes meet the ‚â§150kB specification.


With AD Compressor, you can compress multiple display banner ads with a click. The plugin is completely FREE for use as long as your compression usage is available.


HOW TO USE


1. Install `AD Compressor` and run it inside of a project

2. Enter and verify your Tinify API(require for the first time ‚Äî browser, application or machine)

3. Select frames or objects you want to compress(by default, ONLY the existing & visible FRAME(s) would be automatically selected.)

4. When all the frames are ready, you can hit `COMPRESS` button to compress all images are over 150kB(default)

5. OPTIONAL: if you would like to give a nice formatted prefix for each image, you can use the `OUTPUT PREFIX` input field

6. Once the compression is done, you can `DOWNLOAD` all the final outputs within a ZIP


NOTES


- This plugin would only compress if the image is over than the compression setting(default 150kB), any file sizes are lower than this setting would not run compression(The idea is to make the image size smaller but keep the best quality).


- By default, ONLY the existing FRAME(s) would be automatically selected. If you want to compress anything that is not within a frame, you would need to select individually or select multiples at one time.


- Recently, the plugin has integrated with a free server-side compression(Tinify API ‚Äî TinyPNG) which could provide a better image quality.


- All Responsive ADs(sizes are up to 5 MB) or images are over to 5 MB would skip compressing


Built with love by the ¬©SearchKings team.

plugins.name: Add numbers to texts
plugins.description:
Create numbered lists easily.

plugins.name: Adjustments
plugins.description:
These HSL color adjustments allow you to tweak hue, saturation and lightness values of multiple selected objects at once.

The simple idea behind three sliders becomes a powerful tool when it comes to experiencing color.

You can tweak your palette, find new sweet and vibrant color combinations, make a color theory research or accidentally create brand new design trend.

Adjustments affect all fills, strokes and effects color parameters in the selection including gradient stops. Current version doesn't yet process raster images and mixed text color properties (but you still can have them in your selection).

Adjustments work with any selection including groups and frames, but keep in mind that large selections can impact performance badly.

Any selection change with plugin already running results in resetting the sliders and rebuilding selection color data (careful on large selections).

plugins.name: Advanced SVG Export
plugins.description:
Ever used a third-party tool to optimize SVG, exported from Figma?
 
Well, now you don't have to¬†‚Äì¬†Advanced SVG Export lets you optimize SVG before exporting. Customizable optimizations made possible by using SVGO (https://github.com/svg/svgo) under the hood.

2020 ¬© Okotoki Software

plugins.name: Airstream
plugins.description: Generate swatches from blending and sampling colors.

plugins.name: Airtable to Figma
plugins.description:
Airtable & Figma, kinda sounds like an unusual marriage, right? Sure, until you need to design an entire data table, or a dozen different cards of the same variety, at which point you‚Äôll be wishing for an easier way to go about it. Luckily, now there is! This plugin allows you to effortlessly pull text and images from an Airtable database and inject them straight into your Figma components. Using the plugin is child‚Äôs play. First, you build your component in Figma, business as usual. Then, you load up the Airtable 2 Figma plugin, and map the Airtable data fields to the right layers in Figma. Finally, choose the layout you want your component to be laid out as and voil√†, you just saved yourself a couple hundred clicks! You now have a nice set of data directly inserted  into your designs. Find out more at: https://figma.bothrs.com

Take a gander at the data types we can import directly from Airtable into Figma:

1. Single line text
2. Long text
3. Phone number
4. Email
5. Numeric
6. Image

Here‚Äôs a sample database (about cats) for you to experiment with: https://airtable.com/shr0hyEnBae0AKKfQ

Next, follow these steps, or watch a tutorial video over at https://figma.bothrs.com

1. Go to https://airtable.com  and build or select your own table
2. In your Airtable of choice, click ‚ÄòShare‚Äô
3. Scroll down and click ‚ÄòCreate a shared view‚Äô
4. Click ‚ÄòShare the current view‚Äô
5. Next, click ‚ÄòCreate a shareable grid view‚Äô.
6. Then, copy the link and paste it in the plugin window.
7. Assign Airtable columns to text nodes or images.
8. Select the view you want to use and configure the rest
9. Done! For every row in your table, an instance will be created.

Sounds pretty cool, right?

Missing a particular feature? Hit us up at figma@bothrs.com

plugins.name: alex - catch insensitive, inconsiderate writing
plugins.description:
Whether your own or someone else‚Äôs writing, alex helps you find gender favoring, polarising, race related, religion inconsiderate, or other unequal phrasing.

This plugin will help you to write thoughtful, inclusive copy when working with text in Figma.

Powered by https://alexjs.com

plugins.name: Align To
plugins.description:
Want to align layers to a specific layer, and have that layer stay fixed while the other layers move? You got it!

How it works:
1. Select the layers you'd like to align
2. Launch the Plugin
3. You can select the layers when the plugin is already active, just click on "Get Selection" button.
4. Select the layer you'd like to stay fixed.
5. Click on the Alignment buttons.

Enjoy.

plugins.name: All to 8px multiples
plugins.description:
This plugin will round to nearest multiplier of 8 every X and Y distances on the selected objects.

 

Select a group of objects and run the plugin. No need to set anything or click a button. 

 

X, and Y values of the selected objects will become 8, 16, 24, 32...

plugins.name: Anchor Resizer
plugins.description:
Resize selected layer from any corner or direction.

The plugin behaves as if you are resizing with alt/opt key pressed, but with more options.

HOW TO USE:
1. Select any layer.
2. Change the anchor to the desired one.
3. Type the new dimensions in the the proper fields.

PRO TIP:
Use up & down to nudge the layer size.  Use it with shift to nudge by 10.

plugins.name: Android Pixel Density Export Settings
plugins.description:
This is a utility plugin that applies the export settings for different pixel density sizes on Android. You can read the documentation in the link below around why density independent pixels are used to support multiple devices. 

https://developer.android.com/training/multiscreen/screendensities

How to Use 

1. Select the frame containing the asset you'd like to export
2. Press `command + /` or search for `Android Pixel Density Export Settings` in the Plugins menu
3. Run the plugin
4. Export settings should be prefilled 

All credit goes to @brian (Brian Lovin) whose plugin (iOS Export Settings) gave me the initial idea and also allowed me to fork his repo on GitHub and tweak a few values to publish this plugin.

Feel free to ping me on Twitter @justinmfarrugia if you have any questions or ideas around how I can extend this plugin.

plugins.name: Android Resources Export
plugins.description:
Export png, nine-patch, adaptive icon in Android folder structure (drawable-xhdpi, etc..). 

TIPS

- Run "New PNG" will add slice layers for every selected layers. You can aslo add slice layer by yourself, or add a export to layer.

- You must use "New Nine-Patch" to create a nine-patch asset, or duplicate a nine-patch asset then change the content.

- Before running "Export PNG" or "Export Nine-Patch", you can select some assets, they will be listed on plugin UI. And if have no selected layer in page, it will list all assets in document.

- You can use the "Export PNG" or "Export Nine-Patch" plugin button on the inspector panel to export assets.

- Click the preview image of asset on plugin UI, you can show the layer center in canvas. 

- If you change the layer or asset name when plugin running, you need to run plugin again (cmd+alt+p) to apply the change.

- Run "New App Icon" will create icon template in a new page, you can create multiple icons. Select the app icon page, hide all icon grid layer then run "Export App Icon" to export it.

plugins.name: Android Vector Drawable
plugins.description:
Copy & export vector drawable code from any layers except Slice and Image.

How to Use

Run plugin and select a layer, vector drawable code will show in plugin panel.

How to Remove `android:fillType="evenOdd"`

Vector drawable with attribute fillType is only used in API level 24 and higher, if you need to remove it, install "Fill Rule Editor" plugin to change the fill rule to non-zero.

plugins.name: Android WebP Generator
plugins.description:
Converts any selected object into a webP file.

This plugin is specifically meant to be used for android development. 

The objects are saved into the default android resource folders:
1x - drawable-mdpi
1.5x - drawable-hdpi
2x - drawable-xhdpi
3x - drawable-xxhdpi
4x - drawable-xxxhdpi

Check out the source code here:
https://github.com/ServePeak/Figma-Android-WebP-Generator

plugins.name: Angle Mockups
plugins.description:
Apply your screen designs to perspective mockups. The plugin is free and does not require an account. If you wish to use our huge library of 1000+ mockups in full vector, check out https://Angle.sh

For this plugin to work, you will need to create a Screen vector shape where you want to apply your app design. This can be drawn with the Pen tool (P) with 4 corners in this specific order: top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left and back to top left.

For more instructions, please check this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtN1eQI27Fw

It is recommended to use our free sample mockups where the Mockups are already drawn for you. If you have any question, please contact us.

plugins.name: Anima
plugins.description:
Publish websites with Figma or export HTML in a single click!

Some of the things you can do with Anima for Figma:

* Export HTML and CSS

* Publish live websites from Figma with a single click

* User testing with prototypes that feel real

* Embed Live forms, Videos/GIFs/Lottie, Breakpoints, Live chat, Google Map, or any custom code

Anima converts your Figma design to code.

The possibilities are endless.

Try it out, it‚Äôs free to start!

For more information: www.animaapp.com/figma

plugins.name: Annotate it!
plugins.description:
Annotate it! is a plugin to help you automate the process of annotating your designs for a smooth and effective developer handoff.


‚Ä¢ Drag to reorder

‚Ä¢ Markdown text for smart formatting

‚Ä¢ Smart annotation marker placement

‚Ä¢ Assign a color for various intents

‚Ä¢ Update, Edit, Delete annotations and Annotate It! reorders your annotations automatically


‚Äî


How does it work?


‚Ä¢ Select a frame on your figma page to add annotation to.

‚Ä¢ Click Add New button to add an annotation.

‚Ä¢ Select a color for your marker if you‚Äôd like to create annotations for different purposes.

‚Ä¢ Click on the Trash-button to delete an annotation (the numbers will update auto-magically).

‚Ä¢ You can also use markdown for formatting your annotation description:

**Bold**

_Italics_

Underlined

~Strikethrough~

- Unordered List

1. Ordered List

--- Divider


‚Äî


The Plugin was Crafted & Designed by @sonaliagrawal, and Developed by @madebyfabian.


It's Open Source, so for contributing, please visit https://github.com/madebyfabian/figma-plugin-annotate-it/


‚Äî


If you have any ideas for features, issues or perhaps ways to improve the plugin, we would love to hear from you via the Feedback-Button inside the Plugin, via Twitter (@sonaliagrawal and @madebyfabian), via a Github Issue or via Email (annotate-it@uxtionary.com).


Made with ‚ô• in Dallas, Texas & Nuremberg, Germany.

plugins.name: Annotation
plugins.description:
Annotation Time-Saver for you‚ö°Ô∏è‚ö°Ô∏è
simply select on any text or group elements to create annotations!

üìå Current support two type of annotation:
üëâ Outline: a border annotation that tells whether the container's width / height should be fixed or dynamic expand.
üëâ Spacing: spacing inside a group of elements, ignore children (for example the background) by rename the element's name as `$bg`
üöß Flow: arrow connecting between two frame

üìå Roadmap
üëâ Number indicator (value and unit) for spacing
üëâ flow type of annotation

plugins.name: Anywhere Picker
plugins.description:
Finally in Figma! Pick a color from anywhere on your desktop. Colors are automatically copied to your clipboard.

It can't get any simpler.

plugins.name: API / JSON Sync
plugins.description:
Sync your design with API data

Features
- Load JSON from API url or paste as text
- Navigate your JSON in a simple interface and select path
- Populate, connect and sync your layers with text and images

Demo
https://twitter.com/eminsinani/status/1254058106713186304

Formatting
Because data does not always come in the way we want to visualize it, you can format your results before populating. For flexibility the formatting is done using js code where you can use $value as the variable coming from the JSON. Here are a few examples:
- John-follower -> $value.split('-')[0] -> John
- 224.50 ->  '‚Ç¨ ' + Math.round($value) -> ‚Ç¨ 225
- true -> $value ? 'available' : 'occupied' -> available
- 1 -> ['Clear', 'Rain', 'Snow'][$value] -> Rain
- 1988 -> "'" + ($value).toString().substring(2,4) -> '88
- klm -> `https://airlines/${$value}.png` -> https://airlines/klm.png

API Request Options
In the case you need to add request options to your API call, you can do so in a separate field and provide the options as an object. To find out which options are available and how they are named, check out the following library: https://github.com/Jam3/xhr-request
Example usage:
{
  "headers":{
     "secret-key":"XXX"
  }
}

Notes
- Supports only JSON
- You need to manually select which arrays to loop through after selecting the path
- Data connected to Component layers do not get transferred to its instances. In this case, connect the data to the instance instead, when you copy an instance the data stays connected.
- To multiply layers quickly, install the Multiply plugin
- If you the amount of layers on your page exceeds the limit, the info on the sync page will not auto-refresh when something changes on the page, instead you can use the manual refresh button. This is done to improve performance.

Let me know on Twitter if you have questions, requests or feedback!

plugins.name: Appearance
plugins.description:
This plugin generates a dark/light theme from your selection.
The plugin works with external library styles and local styles.
You can choose styles name identification in settings. By default, the plugin use [day] for light and [night] for dark.

ü§ì How it works:
1. Use [day] and [night] in your style names. Example: Style name[day]/ Style name[night].
2. Apply your color styles.
3. Select any object, then choose Appearance ‚Üí Dark mode or Appearance ‚Üí Light mode.

üìî How it works with external library styles:
1. Open external library file and use [day] and [night] in color style names. Example: Style name[day]/ Style name[night].
2. Publish changes.
3. Select Appearance ‚Üí Save styles for saving external color styles to the plugin.
4. Open any file linked to the library. 
5. Apply color styles.
6. Select any object then choose Appearance ‚Üí Dark mode or Appearance ‚Üí Light mode

---

‚úèÔ∏è Name examples:
You can use [day] / [night] at any place of your style names.
‚Ä®
Color name [day]
Color name [night]
‚Ä®
Style [day] / color-name
Style [night] / color-name
‚Ä®
Style / color-name [day]
Style / color-name [night]

plugins.name: Applanga
plugins.description:
Localization & Translation Plugin - 

Applanga is a localization management platform for continuous software localization projects. It is designed to automate localization tasks for developers and offers business users a single place to manage all parts of the localization and translation workflow in as much detail as desired. 

Learn more on the Applanga website: applanga.com

Applanga and Figma 
The Applanga Figma plugin makes it easy to start your translation process already in the design stage and uses the text elements and layouts in your Figma file as the starting point. 

As a designer, you can easily collaborate with your product and developer teams on Applanga without any back and forth or the need to convert your designs into any other format.   

You can simply upload everything, all texts as well as screenshots via the plugin. On Applanga the screenshots serve as valuable context for your translators. 

In Short
Upload all your text from Figma to Applanga
Generate screenshots of your designs and upload them too. Download translations from Applanga to preview them in your designs

You can find the full Figma plugin documentation here https://www.applanga.com/docs/integration-documentation/figma

This plugin requires an Applanga account. Sign-up for free here https://dashboard.applanga.com/#!/signup

plugins.name: Apply Colors to Selection
plugins.description:
1. (Optional) Before opening the plugin, select the element(s) who's fill color you want to use as a swatch.

2. Open the plugin and add/remove any swatches you want. Adding a new one will generate a new random color.

3. Back on the canvas, select all the elements you want and hit "Apply Colors". The selection will be filled randomly using the swatches.

The plugin doesn't automatically close so you can hit "Apply Colors" as many times as you like.

---

HINT: If you want more of one color than any others, add more swatches of that color.

plugins.name: Apply Current Background to All Pages
plugins.description:
A tiny plugin that allows you to set all pages backgrounds to the same color as the current page. So if you want to change backgrounds on all pages, you can change just one and use this plugin to apply it to all other pages automatically.

Usage: Go to a page in the file, run the plugin, and the plugin will copy current page background to all other pages.

üíñ The process of making this plugin was livestreamed:
https://youtu.be/2xHC5mz-To0

plugins.name: Arabic & RTL Support
plugins.description:
Write Arabic and RTL text in Figma with ease.  Just select a text layer, open the plugin and start writing.

It will also save the original text in case you wanted to update it.

ùóôùóòùóîùóßùó®ùó•ùóòùó¶
‚Ä¢ Reshapes Arabic glyphs properly.
‚Ä¢ Handles mixed English & Arabic text.
‚Ä¢ Provides options/workarounds to fix Figma's limitations with Arabic fonts.
‚Ä¢ Supports multiline text.
‚Ä¢ Handles numbers in text.

ùóüùóúùó†ùóúùóßùóîùóßùóúùó¢ùó°ùó¶
‚Ä¢ Figma partially reshapes Arabic which causes unexpected results.

plugins.name: arc
plugins.description:
One of the most desired text features has just come to Figma with our Arc plugin! Curve your text upward, downward or into a circle. Adjust the slider and preview the result.

1) Select a text layer
2) Run the Arc plugin
3) Adjust the slider & click apply

NOTE: Once the curve is applied, you can still edit the style of the text. However you will not be able to edit the curve path or retype a phrase.

plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiving frames within a design lifecycle is good practice to ensure that design assets are not lost, while also not getting in the way of current work.

Archiver is the best way to quickly and seamlessly archive frames in Figma.

Simply select all the frames and layers you'd like to archive, run the plugin, and Archiver will create an 'Archive' page containing all the selected work, along with newly added time stamps.

plugins.name: Arrow Auto
plugins.description:
***Draw smooth and consistent arrows.

***Auto-track positions in updating mode.


Always moving the elements around? No worries! Just switch on "Update Positions" and all the arrows will auto-track the elements' position. Easy!


- Select two elements and click "Link" to draw an arrow. The arrow group will be named automatically.

- All arrows will be arranged inside a group named "Updating Arrows" automatically.

- You can choose to link elements left-to-right, right-to-right or left-to-left.

- Both ends of the arrow can be either circle or arrowhead.

- Adjust the color, opacity and stroke width of all arrows together. Easily keep the arrow style consistent.

- Lock/unlock all arrows so that they will not disturb your work.


----------Things to notice-------------


- Only arrows inside the "Updating Arrows" group will be able to track positions. "Updating Arrows" group should not be inside any frames or groups.

- This version of Arrow Auto is not compatible with the old version due to the re-write of data structure.

- Updating mode might affect the file's editing performance if the file is too big. Please switch off the mode when not using.


Upcoming updates:

- Preserving overrides


Feel free to reach out to chenmu.wu@shopee.com if you encounter any problems

plugins.name: Artboard Creator
plugins.description:
The fastest way to create multiple artboards.
You can specify artboard names and size with Google Spreadsheet.

============

Instructions
Step 1:
Create new Google Spreadsheet and enter the artboard name, width, and height in this order. No header row is needed. 
It will look like this:
Artboard1, 375, 812
Artboard2, 1600, 900

Step 2:
At the top, select "File" > "Publish to the web" and click "Publish".

Notes: This is not the way to the share you normally do.

Step 3:
Get Spreadsheet ID from URL.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/[HERE_IS_SPREADSHEET_ID]/edit#gid=0

Step 4:
Launch this plugin . Paste Spreadsheet ID and click 'Create' button.

============

Options
Wrap every: You can specify how many artboard layouts to wrap. For example, if you specify 10, 10 artboards will be lined up.
Render artboard name: Generates a layer that displays the artboard name at the top of each artboard
============

Thanks: Figma Plugin DS thomas-lowry/figma-plugin-ds

plugins.name: Artboard Studio Mockups
plugins.description:
Create mockups in Figma easily by getting access to thousands of world-class quality Artboard Studio mockup items right inside your Figma files. Easily render Figma frames into real-life product mockups with a click of a button. More items are added to our ever-growing library every day.

Demo video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nlfhPeAvK4Q

How to use:
1. Follow the on-screen guide and create a secret API key on Artboard Studio.
2. Paste your secret API key into the plugin window, save and start adding mockup items right into your current Figma file.
3. All imported items are fully layered and customizable.
4. Items that have renderable labels come with relevant frames. Copy and paste your designs into those frames, make sure the frame is selected and click Render Selected Frame.
5. You can resize frames and mockup items, it will still work as long as you keep the aspect ratio.
6. To unlock access to our premium items, subscribe to one of our premium plans. It will automatically unlock all items next time you use the Artboard Studio plugin in Figma.
7. Use the menus on the top of the items to search and filter items based on name, viewpoint, and category.
8. Happy Designing üòâ

Road map:
1. Enabling "Quick Render" for Figma browser (due to an unknown bug it currently only works on the the desktop version of Figma)
2. Ability to assign your current frames to Artboard Studio mockup items.
3. Automatically render frame changes into mockup items (we are waiting for Figma team to release long-running plugins and events for plugins)
4. Adding more items every day will never leave our road map, check back every day to see new items fresh out of the oven üòã

plugins.name: Aspect Ratio
plugins.description:
üîåAspect Ratio is a Figma-optimized aspect ratio calculator.

‚öôÔ∏èFeatures
- Inspect : When you select any layer, the aspect ratio value of the layer will be displayed in the inspector area.
- Calculate : Enter the value you want to calculate in the middle input field, and the value will be calculated.
- Resize : Click the Resize button to apply the calculated value to the selected layer.

üößUpcoming features
- Ratio presets (2:1, 3:2, 4:3, 16:9, Golden Ratio, Silver Ratio etc...)

üí´Feature requests or Questions
Just hit me on Web (https://okazu.co), via mail (hello@okazu.co)

plugins.name: Aspects
plugins.description:
Aspects is a little plugin that helps resize selected elements to fit a certain aspect ratio. This plugin is mostly designed for images, but works with any type of layer.


USAGE


  1. Select one or more layers and launch the Aspects plugin.
  2. In the dialog box, type your desired aspect ratio.
  3. Select which property you want changed to match the aspect ratio.
  4. Click "Apply" to apply the resizing.


EXAMPLE


  1. Let's imagine we have an image layer with the following dimensions: 160px by 160px.
  2. In the ‚ÄúAspect ratio‚Äù form field, type 16 and 9.
  3. Select the height as the property to change.
  4. Clicking "Apply" will resize the image's height to 90px.


THANK YOU!


If you have any questions, feedback or anything Figma related, please reach us on Twitter @intudio or shoot us an email at hello@intud.io.

plugins.name: AssetSheet
plugins.description:
With AssetSheet, you can easily create a sheet of all selected components on the current page. Sync those sheets to Zeplin or any other inspection tool to give developers access to all assets they need nicely organized in a single frame.

How to use it

1. Go to the page you want to create a sheet for
Activate Asset Sheet
2. Set element and frame padding
3. Create the sheet (You can either create a sheet from a selection of components or all components on the page)

Features

‚úÖ Organize all components in a single Frame
‚úÖ Either create the sheet from component instances or master components
‚úÖ Automatically create slices for each end every component
‚úÖ Works with different sized components
‚úÖ Adjust the spacing between elements and frame padding

plugins.name: Atlas ‚Äì Theme Manager
plugins.description:
Although Figma is a great tool in many ways one feature that is dearly missing is managing and applying themes. Theming is essential to a lot of applications, most have at least a light and dark mode.


See examples at jwels.berlin/atlas


Makes sense

Atlas is designed to work well with Figma's styling system and established forward-slash naming scheme, thus fitting in well with your workflow and existing documents. It's designed to feel like an addition to Figmas UI rather than an external tool.


Safe to delete

Many plugins safe a lot of state about your themes that are lost when you decide not to use them anymore. Atlas saves minimal information about your Themes so you can delete it safely without any hassle.


Works with teams

Although Figma plugins cannot scan for styles beyond a local document, you can generate and export Maps to use them in other documents, making working with team styles possible.


Have questions or feedback? Reach out on twitter.com/JulianWels

plugins.name: Attributed Text Copy Helper
plugins.description:
The plugin is used to easily copy attributed text just by selecting text node.
Default use case:
When developing applications in XCode, it's fast just to copy text from design viewer and paste attributed string into storyboard/xib's UILabel/UITextField `attributedText` field.

So, how it works:
0. Start Plugin
1. Select TextNode in side navigator or on canvas
That's it, now you have attributed text from TextNode copied into your clipboard! Paste it into editors, what support that and enjoy!

plugins.name: Auto Image Swapper
plugins.description: Automatically swap an image layers image with an inputed URL when there is a single layer name "IMAGE".

plugins.name: Auto Layout Sorter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you sort child layers of an Auto Layout frame based on their common text layer names. It's an ideal plugin if you work a lot with tables or long lists of components and you don't want to spend time and manual labour to sort each layer by hand. With this plugin you can sort your layers with just a few clicks

**How it works**
1. Select an Auto Layout frame and make sure it has child layers with corresponding text layer names
2. The plugin will check what text values can be sorted and displays this in the plugin interface.
3. Choose the type of text value you want to sort
4. Choose ascending or descending
5. And lastly ‚Üí hit the 'Sort' button

Your list view has been sorted!

plugins.name: Autocover
plugins.description: Select a FRAME from your design to easily make a "Cover" page for your design files.

plugins.name: Autocrop
plugins.description:
Automatically crop the extra space surrounding an image.

An image in Figma is actually a shape (typically a rectangle) with an image fill. This plugin supports cropping of 1 or more rectangle shaped images.

plugins.name: Autoflow
plugins.description:
Autoflow makes it easy to draw flows. Simply select 2 objects and a line will be magically drawn between them.


  1. Run Autoflow
  2. Select any 2 shapes whille holding down ‚áßSHIFT and a line will be drawn
  3. Keep selecting until you're all wired up!


Made by Yitong Zhang (@zhayitong) and David Zhao (@davidtzhao)

plugins.name: AutoGrid
plugins.description:
Grid support for Figma's AutoLayout! Define rows, columns and padding and let AutoGrid do the rest.

Find yourself constantly creating multiple AutoLayout layers just to keep your 24 cards in a neat layout?

With AutoGrid keeping your grids in sync is a breeze:
1) Select a root item for your grid (e.g. one single card or a selection of multiple cards)
2) Define your grid structure: How many rows, columns and padding should the new grid have?
3) Press "Create new grid".
-> AutoGrid will clone your root item (if you only selected one) or arrange your selection so it fills up the newly created grid (right now it won't duplicate items if you selected more than one).

Auto-Update:
With Auto-Update you dont have to manually update your grid any time your structure changes (e.g. you delete an item, you move items around, etc.).
Whenever a row has more columns than you specified in your grid structure the plugin will automatically rearrange your grid.

Motivation for this plugin:
I constantly found myself creating rows of items to make up a grid, and whenever I moved an item around I had to restructure it all, resulting in a lot of wasted time. Also I couldnt use Figma's Tidy Up feature as it doesnt allow me to specify columns or rows - plus when you delete or move an item the flow is broken.

Did you run into any issues or do you want to contribute?
This plugin is open sourced at https://github.com/six7/auto-grid

plugins.name: AutoLayout
plugins.description:
AutoLayout dynamically lays out layers in frames and updates the layout when the dimensions of child layers change. It behaves similar to Framer Stacks and the Anima Toolkit for Sketch. 

Creating a simple list
1. Wrap the list elements in a frame
2. Open the Auto Layout plugin, select the frame and enable the toggle ‚ÄòLayout frame‚Äô
3. Change the direction to vertical and adjust spacing

How to create an auto-reflowing To Do list
1. Create a text layer and a rectangle as checkbox next to it for the first todo item.
2. Wrap both elements in a frame ( ‚åò + ‚å• + G )
3. Open AutoLayout and enable it for the frame. Set direction to horizontal and adjust padding/alignment to your liking. You can change the order by moving layers up and down in the layers sidebar. 
4. With the frame selected, set Height to ‚ÄòResize To Fit‚Äô in AutoLayout which will automatically resize the frame when the text field gets longer
5. Duplicate the frame a few times below to create a list of todos
6. Wrap all todo items in a frame and enable AutoLayout, set the direction to vertical. You can adjust spacing between the items.
7. Try adding a linebreak in one of the todo items to make it larger. The items below will automatically move down to make room.

The layout of the frame will update every second if either a child layer or the frame itself is selected. To update the layour, select a child layer or the frame while the plugin is open. 

AutoLayout is based on the Yoga implementation of Flexbox. Inspired by prior work from Scott Horsfall @scoh and Zachary Schiller @zacharyschiller

plugins.name: Automatic Style Guides
plugins.description:
üî• Style Guide Generator üî•


Preparing formal style guide documentation from your local styles (and keeping it updated!) has always felt like double entry to me. But thanks to the Figma API you can now prepare a presentable style guide for clients & developers with a click of a button.


üí™ How It Works üí™


Generate A Style Guide


1. Create some local text & color styles

2. Press Automatic Style Guides > Generate Style Guide

3. A new page called "Style Guide‚Äù has been added to your document


‚Ä¶or keep your own style guide updated with moustache tags!


1. Create some local text & color styles

2. Find the text layer you want updated with your local style property value

3. Rename that text layer something like {{myTextStyle.fontSize}}

4. Press Automatic Style Guides > Update Moustache Tags

5. The text layer named {{myTextStyle.fontSize}} will have its contents updated to myTextStyle's font size (ie. 12px).


Available Merge Tags

Text Styles

{{myTextStyle.id}}

{{myTextStyle.type}}

{{myTextStyle.name}}

{{myTextStyle.description}}

{{myTextStyle.fontFamily}}

{{myTextStyle.fontStyle}}

{{myTextStyle.fontSize}}

{{myTextStyle.letterSpacing}}

{{myTextStyle.lineHeight}}

{{myTextStyle.textCase}}

{{myTextStyle.textDecoration}}

{{myTextStyle.paragraphSpacing}}


Color Styles

{{myColorStyle.id}}

{{myColorStyle.type}}

{{myColorStyle.name}}

{{myColorStyle.description}}

{{myColorStyle.key}}

{{myColorStyle.paints}}

{{myColorStyle.r}}

{{myColorStyle.g}}

{{myColorStyle.b}}

{{myColorStyle.a}}

{{myColorStyle.rgba}}

{{myColorStyle.hex}}


üö® Warnings üö®

Styles that start with a space are not supported.

Only the first fill of a local paint style will be used.

Ensure that all styles are uniquely named. If not, it will be skipped.

Everything is sensitive to case. If something isn't working, double check your sentence case.


üêõKnown Bugs üêõ

Long colour style names have text overflow issues.


üí´ Roadmap üí´

Title pages and grouping for your Local Style Groups (styles with a ‚Äú/")


üí• Bugs or Feature Requests? üí•

Email support@jordangeizer.com - I'd love to hear of any ideas or issues you may have!

plugins.name: autoRename
plugins.description: The text layer name will be auto-derived from characters.

plugins.name: Avatars
plugins.description:
Add random user avatars to your designs with one click!

Select any type of element and run the plugin. It will fetch an avatar image and add it as a fill on your selected element.

You can also run the plugin without anything selected and it will add an element with an avatar.

Images are aggregated by UIfaces.co from various sources including randomuser.me, tinyfac.es, imdb.com, donated images, and other sources.

plugins.name: Avatars generator
plugins.description:
Avatars Generator creates unique, AI-generated photos of a fictional persons

How to use:
1. Select any shape (rectangle, ellipse, polygon, star, vector, text)
2. Run the plugin and it will fill a shape with a random photo

‚ö†Ô∏è Plugin supports multiple selection limited by 20 images at a time

Plugin retrieves photos from thispersondoesnotexist.com

plugins.name: Avocode
plugins.description:
Hand-off design versions to other stakeholders who need to work with them, while keeping your work in Figma intact.


In Avocode, anyone from your team can:


- review design versions from Figma & leave feedback (while not seeing all your exploration work)

- click through and edit screen flow logic

- edit copy in text fields

- inspect all layers, get specs, pick colors, export assets as PNG, JPEG, WebP, and SVG

- export pure standards-based CSS, Sass, Stylus, Less, SCSS, CSS in JS, Styled Components, Swift, Android, and React Native from layers


Learn more at https://avocode.com/


How to use the Avocode plugin?


1. Make sure you are logged into your Avocode account.

2. In Figma, go to Plugins and pick Avocode. You should see a new export window.

3. Select any number of frames and hit EXPORT.

4. Avocode will open in a new browser tab. Choose a project or folder where your wish to sync your designs, and that‚Äôs it.


We welcome any feedback on how to improve our Figma plugin. If you have any suggestions or issues, please contact us at team@avocode.com

plugins.name: AxiDraw
plugins.description:
Easily control an AxiDraw drawing machine from Figma. Prepare your vector art and send it to the plotter in one click.


Note: A prompt will invite you to install the required AxiDraw driver on first launch.


This plugin is based on saxi by Jeremy Rose @nornagon.


Thanks to Evil Mad Scientist Laboratories (creators of the AxiDraw) for making pen plotting accessible to almost everyone!


Find out more about AxiDraw: https://axidraw.com/

plugins.name: Axure
plugins.description:
Easily copy frames from Figma to Axure RP 9 or publish frames directly to Axure Cloud.

Copying frames from Figma to Axure RP lets you quickly bring your designs to life with the powerful prototyping capabilities of Axure RP. Simply select your frames in Figma and use this plugin to copy them. Then in Axure RP, paste your design onto the canvas. This feature requires Axure RP version 9.0.0.3694 or newer.

Publishing Frames to Axure Cloud allows you to collaborate with your team, build basic prototypes, and seamlessly hand off visual assets and CSS to the development team. Now, you can keep your RP prototypes and Figma designs in one place! You‚Äôll need to install the Axure Cloud desktop app before using this feature.

plugins.name: Bannerify Banner Studio
plugins.description:
Animate and export production ready banners from Figma to HTML, GIFs and Videos.


Features


  • Criminally easy timeline animation and real-time previews inside Figma.
  • Generates all the images, HTML, CSS and Javascript you need for every banner.
  • Export to HTML/CSS, GSAP, <canvas>, Google Ads, DoubleClick and many more.
  • Export your animated banners to GIFs or MP4/WebM video files.
  • Built-in compression for smaller banner sizes.
  • Optionally include static fallback "backup" JPG for every banner.
  • Impress your clients with beautifully responsive HTML preview pages.
  • Automatically saves all of your exported banners and preview page as a single .zip file.


To use Bannerify


  1. Install Bannerify and create a new Figma project.
  2. Create as many different sized frames as you need for your banners.
  3. Design your banners by adding layers to your frames.
  4. Run Bannerify inside the page containing your banner frames.
  5. Apply animations and timings to the layers inside each frame.
  6. Click the Export to HTML or Export to GIF/Video button.
  7. Choose your export options and click the Export button.
  8. Click the Download your .zip file button and enjoy your banners!


Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.figmaticapp.com/bannerify


Bug Reports


Bannerify is still a baby panda; if you notice any bugs, please get in touch via https://www.figmaticapp.com/contact and we'll publish a fix as soon as possible.


License


After you've tried exporting banners with Bannerify 10 times, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team to animate and export an unlimited amount of HTML banners using Bannerify.


To purchase a license or to find out more about the plugin, please visit https://figmaticapp.com/bannerify

plugins.name: Banners
plugins.description: Add top and bottom banner markings to every page!

plugins.name: Batch Create Component
plugins.description:
Select many things, create many components.

This simple plugin turns selected layers into individual components rather than one big component.

plugins.name: Batch Styler
plugins.description:
Change multiple text and color styles at once!


Need to change values of multiple (text and color) styles at once but don't want to go through the process of changing each text style on its own?


With Batch Styler you can do just that! No matter if 2 or 30 text styles, changing from Inter to Roboto but keeping all font weights and other style is now possible!


Changing colors that are all based on the same hue value is easy as well: Batch Styler will update all styles accordingly.


Do you have feedback or any issues? Head on over to GitHub!


Want to buy me a coffee?

plugins.name: BeatFlyer Lite
plugins.description:
Animate your artboards in a few clicks with a lite and free version of BeatFlyer.


Animate your layers independently combining as many effects as you want among the dozens available (some insanely powerful üî•).


Group your layers properly before running the plugin to give the same combination of effects to multiple elements.


Enjoy!


P.S.: For many more functionalities, exists of course the standard version: https://beatflyer.com/

plugins.name: BestPrice.gr
plugins.description:
This plugin will populate the selected layers with product-related data (title, price and image), based on your query.

How it works:

Select layers (text or rects).

- All text layers containing $ or ‚Ç¨ will be filled with product prices.
All text layers named "descr" or "description" will be populated with product descriptions, if available.
- All text layers that are not handled as "price layers" will be filled with product tiles.
- Rects wil be filled with product covers.

Notes:
1. Too small layers are ignored.
2. Locked layers are ignored.
3. Rects without (visible) fills are ignored.

plugins.name: Better File Thumbnails
plugins.description:
Check out more assets at https://thepentool.co!

Create a thumbnail for your project in a few clicks with a visual editor. Set your brand colors, give it a status, choose an emoji with search and lots more! Take use of the "Quick Create" feature if you don't want to play around with personalization and make an instant thumbnail.

We've got you *covered*, get it?

plugins.name: Better Font Picker
plugins.description:
Well... Like the name suggests, Better Font Picker helps you select fonts with a preview of how it looks. 

Now you can skim through all those 1000s of fonts installed seamlessly as an alternative to the default font picker in figma!

Note: Better Font Picker shows ONLY the list of installed fonts in your system. 

Roadmap:
- [ ] Add to favourites

This plugin is open sourced!
If you find any issues or have some ideas for this plugin, please hit me up on twitter(@nitinrgupta) or create an issue in github - https://github.com/nitinrgupta/figma-better-font-picker/issues

plugins.name: Bibbble
plugins.description:
Bibbble is single source of truth UX/UI screenshot library.

Handpicked solutions from most popular websites.


New! Now includes "Header builder" to speed up your workflow.


Bibbble helps you to:

  • find right layouts / UI & UX solutions for project
  • get inspiration from industry leaders
  • import high-quality screenshots within seconds
  • search design by specific keyword
  • REAL solutions from REAL websites


For inspiration & personal use only. All assets belongs to their original owners & cannot be used commercially.

plugins.name: Blend
plugins.description:
Blend plugin allows you to copy any object along the path. 

How it works
1. Select an object you want to clone, then select the path and the Blend Group will be created (it's a regular group but it stores useful data about the blend so it's not recommended to ungroup it). 
2. Change the number of copies or the distance that you want to keep between them to make the composition fit your needs.
3. While the plugin is open you can also edit the blend path and you will see changes in real time. 

Features
‚Ä¢ You can click on layers to select them, they will also reflect which layer is currently selected on the canvas. 
‚Ä¢ Replace blend path or object by clicking the pencil icon near them and selecting the object you want to change it to.
‚Ä¢¬†Click the Remove Blend button to quickly remove all copies and keep your original object and path.

Tips
‚Ä¢ Use an instance of a component as the main object to be able to easily change its properties.
‚Ä¢ Select an object and a path when opening the plugin and it may be able to automatically detect them and create the Blend Group.
‚Ä¢ Select an existing blend group when opening the plugin to edit it instead of creating a new one.

Known issues
‚Ä¢ If you edited the node you are copying, change the number of steps to update the copies.
‚Ä¢¬†If you use Cmd + Z it may break the blend and you will have to manually remove copies, reselect the missing object or restart the plugin.
‚Ä¢ You cannot use anything other than a simple vector object as a path. If you want to use a shape like an ellipse, flatten it first (Right-click -> Flatten).

plugins.name: BlendingMe
plugins.description:
BlendingMe it's the best way to create a blend for two lines, ellipses or rectangles. As easy as possible - just select two objects you want to blend, choose a count of blending steps and click on Create.


You can change blending path, colour, stroke weight and opacity in REALTIME while plugin is working. When you'll be satisfied with a result, just click Done. That's it!


How does it work step by step?

1. Create two lines with a Pen tool (You can also create ellipses or rectangles).

2. Select lines you want to blend (or any figure you've created)

3. Choose count of blending steps

4. Click Create üéâ


What BlendingMe can Blend:

‚Äî Paths of two lines

‚Äî Elipses and Rectangles

‚Äî Solid stroke colour

‚Äî Solid fill colour

‚Äî Strokes weight

‚Äî Opacity

‚Äî Rotation

‚Äî Position

‚Äî Size


BlendingMe will be updated. And it will have more features for sure üôÇ


If you want to support my work in creating plugins, please join my Patreon Community ü•∞

I also accept one-time donations via PayPal

plugins.name: Blobs
plugins.description:
Create organic blob shapes with the click of a button. Every shape that is generated is unique to the last. You can control how unique a shape is  along with how many points it has.

Shapes are created using SVG, so you get those oh-so-sweet b√©zier curves.

plugins.name: blokdots
plugins.description:
blokdots is a simple to use software to build interactive hardware prototypes without a line of code.

With this plugin you can connect Figma to the blokdots app (--> download at blokdots.com), making it possible to use hardware components like sensors and buttons to control and manipulate elements right in Figma. This means it is now possible to bridge the gap between hardware and UI prototypes!

‚Äî What you can do
You can use hardware components to set the text, color, size, rotation or position of Figma layers and map the values of your sensors to the color, size, rotation or position of a layer.

‚Äî How to use the Plugin
While the blokdots app is running, run the plugin and select the layer you want to be able to manipulate with your hardware prototype. Then press the ‚ÄúExpose to blokdots‚Äù button.

[Make sure to enable the Figma integration in blokdots ‚Äì Go to settings and toggle ‚ÄúFigma Integration‚Äù on. It‚Äôs located under ‚ÄúExperimental Features‚Äù.]

You can now select ‚ÄúFigma‚Äù as a component in any card in blokdots, select one of the layers you exposed and define how it should respond.

When you run your project in blokdots, make sure the blokdots plugin in Figma is running as well. blokdots and Figma will connect automatically and you can now manipulate Figma layers right from your hardware prototype!

‚Äî Requirements
To use this plugin you need to ‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ have the blokdots app installed and running --> download at blokdots.com
‚Ä¢ have an Arduino microcontroller set up
‚Ä¢ use the Figma Desktop version

plugins.name: Blurhash
plugins.description:
Make your frame blur, generate and translate blur hash code directly in your figma design

Features:

- Generate BlurHash
- Translate BlurHash

plugins.name: Blush
plugins.description:
Create and customize illustrations in your designs with Blush. Just choose a collection, pick a composition, and place it on the canvas. You can keep playing with the variations in the illustration to create something unique that fits your brand.


MIX-AND-MATCH

Blush works with mixable elements, so you can customize every variablee of an illustration to create your own unique compositions. It's like playing with legos, made of vectors.


RANDOM

If you‚Äôre feeling lucky, just click the Random button to shuffle the components in a composition. Embrace the chaos! (controlled chaos)


ARTISTS

You'll have access to gorgeous illustrations by artists from around the globe. We're collaborating with some of the most talented illustrators to keep creating collections with unique styles every week.


FREE LICENSE

We have a forever-free plan that allows you to use any illustration for personal and commercial purposes. Just create an account to start designing stuff! Worry-free!


SVG

If you need SVG, more control over the layers, print-level resolution, and other advanced functionality, subscribe to our paid plan. Your support will help bring more amazing illustrators to Blush (and support our caffeine addiction.)


We can‚Äôt wait to see what you create with Blush!


Share your creations with the hashtag #madewithblush

plugins.name: Bookmarks
plugins.description:
Create shortcuts to any layer in your design.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
How to use:

Add Bookmark:
1. Select a layer and run Bookmarks > Add Bookmark.
2. Enter a name for your bookmark. (The "Use layer name" option allows you to sync the bookmark's name to its layer name, even if it is changed later)

(If you have the bookmarks viewer opened, you can add a bookmark by selecting a layer and clicking the + button in the top right.)

Show Bookmarks:
- Run Bookmarks -> Show Bookmarks.
- If there are any bookmarks in the current file, a "Show Bookmarks" button will also be shown in the property pane when no layer is selected.

Clicking on a bookmark will jump you to that layer and select it.

Rename Bookmarks:
- Right click on a bookmark and click Rename.

Delete Bookmarks:
- Right click on a bookmark and click Delete.

Switch views:
- Click on the Show as List/Grid button in the top right to swtich between List view and Grid view.

plugins.name: Bootstrap Icons
plugins.description:
Add icons from Bootstrap icon library directly as SVG in your Figma projects. Find the appropriate icon in the list of 1120 icons.


They're open sourced (MIT), so you're free to download, use, and extend. Heads up though, they're in alpha right now and subject to sweeping changes.

plugins.name: Border
plugins.description:
Quickly add single borders in Frame.

Usage:
1. Open 'Border' from the plugin menu.
2. Select one or more frames.
3. Click button to toggle borders.

plugins.name: Borders
plugins.description: Figma plugin that add independent borders to each side of a FRAME element with constraints.

plugins.name: Box It
plugins.description:
Create a bounding box around your selection with padding.

‚óæ Usage ‚óæ
Select 1+ layers and run the plugin to draw a bounding box around your selection. You can then change the inputs to adjust the padding of the box.

‚óæ Using your own box ‚óæ
You can use your own bounding box by appending the ":boxed" suffix to the end of a selected layer's name. Box-It will either use the first :boxed layer found in your selection or create a new :boxed rectangle if none exists.

plugins.name: Boxicons
plugins.description:
Browse, find, use icons from boxicons.com right from inside Figma!

FEATURES
‚Ä¢ All 1200+ icons from boxicons.com
‚Ä¢ Always latest icons

SPECIAL THANKS TO
boxicons.com, jsdelivr.com, fuse.js, react-window

plugins.name: Brands Colors
plugins.description:
Find the best color from the world's best brands and cool apps

Fill beautiful colors from ‚ÄúBrands Colors plugin‚Äù straight into your design.

With Brands Colors for Figma, you can search for your favorite brand's colors or app's colors and apply it on your design and make it awesome

The Brands Colors allows being used freely for both commercial and personal projects.

Just Copy & Fill to your amazing design projects.
Have fun! ‚úåÔ∏è

plugins.name: Breakpoints
plugins.description:
Breakpoints are finally in Figma as a resizable instance #frame that works even without the opened plugin window. It means that for all collaborators in your team, the Breakpoints work correctly.


‚ñ∫ https://youtu.be/OaGSreqHCXE


Select values for points, link your existing designs with each range and get a Figma frame that switches between different layouts during resizing.


Checkout demo file:

https://www.figma.com/file/Ovn2qOslN30CLU1ORgFgT1


Features:

‚Üí Works even without opened plugin window

‚Üí Custom values

‚Üí Horizontal and vertical

‚Üí Suitable for Web, Android, iOS/iPadOS

‚Üí Quick resizing to breakpoints

‚Üí Ruler


‚ùñ iOS and iPadOS Size Classes


If you're working on iPhone and iPad designs, the plugin can help you create dynamic layouts for Compact and Regular ranges. There is a magic number 683 for both vertical and horizontal dimensions, which ensures that anything larger is a Regular size, and anything smaller is Compact.


Checkout size classes example file:

https://www.figma.com/file/cMVIf2vKK3qbruCHAPMIGg


Breakpoints are currently in beta and will be released soon as a stable version.


If you have a great idea feel free to contact us by email [bp-support@floweare.com]. We always welcome creative suggestions from our customers.

plugins.name: Bridged (design to flutter)
plugins.description:
Bridged's assistant plugin that generates usable & readable flutter code for production. Run this plugin, Select any design of yours, It will generate ready-to-use formatted native flutter code for you.


Notice

No matter how big and complex frame you select, it will generate the code. Anyway we recommend you to use it on a component level for best experience. Code may not be manageable if you are tring to build full-screen level code in one single code base.


contribute on github

plugins.name: Bring yours Coolors pallet into Figma
plugins.description: Bring your color pallet into figma by pasting Coolors.co URL

plugins.name: Bulk delete styles
plugins.description: Easily delete multiple styles

plugins.name: Bullets
plugins.description:
Create custom bulleted lists using components and save reusable bullet styles on your file.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

‚òû HOW TO CREATE A BULLET STYLE

1. Create a Figma component with your preferred design for the bullet. Make sure to set Scale as constrain on the all component's children;

2. Select the bullet component and click the plus icon on the plugin panel to save it as bullet style;

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

‚òû HOW TO APPLY A BULLET STYLE

1. Select at least one or more layers;

2. Click one of the bullet styles available to add one bullet instance for each selected layer on the canvas. The plugin will organize your layers into a list using Figma Auto-Layout. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

‚òû HOW TO APPLY CHANGES TO THE BULLETS

1. Select the bullets instance layers via the new quick-select feature or manually.

2(A) - You can swap bullets by clicking on a different bullet style via on the plugin.

2(B) - You can change size of the bullets or the auto-layout spacing and alignment via the built-in Figma interface.

‚ùß

plugins.name: Bunch description change
plugins.description:
Change multiple component descriptions at once! Now it's possible. Simple, but very effective!

Based on the Figma rename-tool (CMD + R), it's powerful and simple to use. Just select a few components and open the plugin. 

You can find & replace (even with Regular Expressions if you want), or just change every description on your selection. Also supports importing the recently used values, using incrementing (or decrementing) numbers, the current description and the layer name. 

Has a nice preview to see what your descriptions will look like.

‚Äî

Feature requests? üòä Questions?
Just hit me on Twitter (@madebyfabian), via mail (hello@madebyfabian.com) or via an Issue on GitHub.

‚Äî

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Fabian B. in Nuremberg, Germany. Want to support me? Would appreciate that very much! http://buymeacoff.ee/madebyfabian

plugins.name: Bunch Text Changer
plugins.description:
1. Select one or several text layers
2. Call the plugin
3. Paste or type new value
4. Hit enter. Done!

‚Ä¢ Plugin will change ALL text layers in selected groups, Components, Instances or Frames 

 ‚Ä¢ If all selected layers already have the same value, it will appear in the placeholder (handy for correcting typos)

 ‚Ä¢ input is preselected, so you can call the plugin and type right away

 ‚Ä¢ Block some layers from changihg by staring the layer name with hypen

See demo and some details on working with plugins faster here: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1161070905142984704

plugins.name: Butler
plugins.description:
Butler helps you with three things:

- It let‚Äôs you search for local components to insert your current 
   position

- You can apply any local style to your current selection

- Go to any node in your document

Open the plugin, press TAB to switch commands or search for your desired component or style.

Caveats:

Users working with large documents may experience long loading times, this is due to how you‚Äôre allowed to fetch assets from the API.

Local assets only, meaning that unfortunately styles and components from your libraries won‚Äôt be collected. Also due to what is allowed to collect or not from the API, (and probably righteously so concerning security risks).

I‚Äôve found a kind of similair plugin called Figma Walker made by Kazushi Kawamura, 
you can find his plugins here: https://www.figma.com/@kawamurakazushi

plugins.name: Butter
plugins.description:
Butt-together layers neatly and instantly.
Remove white space and overlaps with one shortcut.

Add quick, consistent spacing between objects
Space and distribute layers evenly in rows or columns. Simpler than the grid or distribute tool. A massive time saver! ‚è±

This plugin is inspired by pberrecloth's butter-sketch-plugin, a great plugin I can't live without using sketch

plugins.name: Button Generator
plugins.description:
Button Generator does what it says on the box, it generates button components with no fuss.    

You can create primary or secondary buttons being able to control properties such as:
     ‚Ä¢ Button size
     ‚Ä¢ Corner radius
     ‚Ä¢ Stroke size
     ‚Ä¢ Button & text color
The generated button components have constraints already set to make resizing buttons a breeze.

How to use:
1. Run Button Generator
2. Enter the properties of your button in the UI
3. Click Create Button

Roadmap:
1. Font selection within the plugin UI
2. Preview of the button within the plugin UI
3. Reusable button 'styles'

Feature requests and support:
Feel free to email me at michael@mtmeyer.net

plugins.name: Button Resizer
plugins.description:
Resize your button to fit its label width.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
How to use:

Resize Button:
* Make sure your button label text layer is set to:
- Constraints: Left & Right
- Resizing: Fixed Size

1. Enter a text in your button label.
2. Select the button frame or component and run "Button Resizer > Resize Button"

Set Min Width:
You can set a minimum width on your button so that the plugin will never resize below it. If you are using a button component it is recommended to set this on the master component so all instances will inherit the minimum width automatically.

1. Select the button frame or component and run "Button Resizer > Set Min Width".
2. Enter a number and click Set.

plugins.name: Calculator for Figma
plugins.description: Use a simple calculator in Figma

plugins.name: Calendar Maker
plugins.description:
See more documentation here https://www.figma.com/file/y3Ux1boMyGTcBHYkFzDDIi/Calendar-Maker

Create a ‚ÄúDay Card‚Äù
Create a component called ‚Äú@day‚Äù this will be the card that is copied for each calendar day. Inside that card create a layer called ‚Äú#background‚Äù and a text field called ‚Äútitle‚Äù. The Plugin will look for those layers and set the text and change the color. 

Date Formatting
Any text nodes that layer name starts with an # symbol will be set based on the date formatting. Follow the momentjs formatting. Ie: MMMM will result in January. The display syntax style that is in the component will be copied to the date text, for example, if the MMMM is all red and set to font size 20 these properties will be copied over. This applies to text and fills styles.

You can hide and show text just for days and months with special filters. If you use the layer name #first-month-text only this text will show up on the first of the month. If you use #day-text this text will show up on all days and will hide any other special filter text.

See formatting here:
https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

Formatting
Set the start and end date for the calendar. You can set margins and gaps for the ‚Äúday cards‚Äù within the plugin ui menu. There are some extra features like skip weekends and breaking at the end of the month. For now, there is a simple color generator these will be used for each month. 

Note: When you re-run the plugin it will remove the frame named ‚ÄúCalendar‚Äù.

plugins.name: Camera Color Copy Paste
plugins.description:
Copy & paste color directly from your camera

How to use:

- Scan QR code in your phone or choose open in browser
- Capture a color from your camera
- New color will be automatically added to the plugin
- Click the color to copy it, or click delete to remove
 
3D Illustration Credits: Alzea Arafat

plugins.name: Capacity Calc
plugins.description:
This plugin is designed to be used in tandem with Kate Pincott's Team Capacity Template.


How to use:

  1. Duplicate the Team Capacity Template from the Figma community
  2. Follow the instructions inside the template file, as it is already configured with plugin relaunch buttons.

plugins.name: Cards for Humanity
plugins.description: Cards for Humanity is Idean's tool for inclusive design. Deal the cards to get a person and a trait. Your challenge is to work out how you can design for their needs.

plugins.name: Change Event Pusher
plugins.description:
Sends the JSON of the current page to the HTTP/WebSocket endpoint of your choosing, everytime your document changes! Dead simple and nimble.

When the plugin is opened and marked "Active", the plugin will watch for any changes in the current page. If there is a change detected, it will send a HTTP/WebSocket request to your chosen endpoint. 

The plugin by itself is not useful, unless you have something that want to receive HTTP/WebSocket requests for every change in the current Figma document.

plugins.name: Change Text
plugins.description:
With Change Text, you can bulk edit the text contents of multiple layers, groups and frames.

You can also replace text in the selected layers.

Coming soon, generate text using a generator function...

plugins.name: Change Text to Layer Name
plugins.description: A plugin that changes text to match the layer name. It also resets the layer name so that the text and layer name are in sync (i.e. changing the text will also change the layer name).

plugins.name: Chaos
plugins.description: Creates randomly sized squares of random colours.

plugins.name: Chart
plugins.description:
Chart is a plugin for Figma that uses real or random data to create the most popular charts. Chart supports copy-paste from editors like Excel, Numbers, Google Sheets, live connection with Google Sheets and remote JSON (REST API), local CSV and JSON files.

Key features:
‚Äî 16 types of charts out-of-the-box
‚Äî creating multiple chart instances
‚Äî generate random data with different trends
‚Äî import data from CSV, JSON, Google Sheets, REST APIs, type to table input or just paste from table processors like Excel
‚Äî customize charts with different options
‚Äî update charts

About Chart:
https://chartplugin.com/

Customer support in Slack:
https://bit.ly/2ZRLFtc 

Pricing:
https://chartplugin.com/pricing.html

plugins.name: Charts
plugins.description:
Charts allows you to generate charts that can be added and edited within your Figma document. Choose from Line, Area, Pie, Doughnut, Scatter and Bar charts. Each chart comes with its own set of configurations such as number of points, max and min values.

If a frame is selected then the chart will be placed within the frame otherwise it will be placed at 0x0 coordinates and the viewport will move to that position
