plugins.name: Rectangle to Frame
plugins.description:
A tiny plugin that allows you to turn rectangles into frames. 

‚≠êÔ∏è How it works:
Sometimes you create a rectangle as a background for something, and then you place some items on top and wish you created a frame in the first place. This plugin allows you to fix this mistake easily. Select a rectangle, then select the objects you want to place in the frame and run the plugin.

TL;DR: It works like auto layout creation but without auto layout.

plugins.name: Redlines
plugins.description:
As designers, when preparing our work for developer hand-off, there comes a time where we need to annotate our designs with detailed measurements, specs, and intricate redlines‚Äîwe all know how time-consuming this process can be.

Alas! There is light at the end of the tunnel. üôå

Figma Redlines is the perfect toolkit for any designer looking to save time when preparing designs for developer hand-off. 

This plugin gives you the ability to create and generate redlines from a selection of objects with ease, while also enabling full control over the style and display of each redline element.

Main Features
- Quickly measure and plot dimensions of any selected object
- A varied selection of outlines and line styles
- Full control over the color, spacing, and font size of each redline element
- Ability to add units to each redline element‚ÄîPX, %, DP, etc.
- Automatic grouping of redline elements‚Äîto help keep things tidy and easy to manage!

To use;
1. Select a layer (or multiple)
2. Customize the redline settings (if you want to)
3. Choose a redline option to plot
4. üï∫

If you have any ideas for features or perhaps ways to improve the plugin,  feel free to reach out‚ÄîI would love to hear from you!

Oh, and if you've enjoyed the plugin and are feeling generous, you can always... https://www.buymeacoffee.com/4pIjUVg

Enjoy!

plugins.name: Regulator
plugins.description:
Bulk rename your color and text styles like a üíØ boss.

Simply run this plugin in a file that has local styles and select which styles you want to rename. You can also numerate your names via $n and $nn, which will add numbers in ascending order of the list. You can also re-use the existing name via $& (just like Figma's bulk rename)

plugins.name: Remove BG
plugins.description:
Remove the background of images automatically with just a single click - using the remove.bg API.
Note: You will need a remove.bg account for this plugin.

plugins.name: Remove Redundant Frames
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to clean up your nests of frames

This plugin removes redundant or empty frames within the selection that have no background, no opacity changes, no applied blend modes, or applied effects. 

To use:
1. Select the frames you'd like to check (you can select multiple frames and they don't have to be root frames on a page!)
2. Run the plugin

plugins.name: Rename It
plugins.description:
Keep your Figma files organized, batch rename layers and frames.

‚Ä¢ Mutiple Layers
   Rename Multiple layers at once.

‚Ä¢ Sequence
   Sequentially rename layers in either ascending or descending order.
   ‚Üí Keyword %n - Ascending numbered sequence
   ‚Üí Keyword %N - Descending numbered sequence
   ‚Üí Keyword %A - Alphabet sequence

‚Ä¢ Current Layer Name
   The keyword %* will copy the current selected layer(s) name.

‚Ä¢ Layer Name Case
   You can use the %* with combination of letters to convert the layer name case.
   ‚Üí Keyword %*u% - Convert to UPPER CASE
   ‚Üí Keyword %*l% - Convert to lower case
   ‚Üí Keyword %*t% - Convert to Title Case
   ‚Üí Keyword %*uf% - Convert to Upper first word
   ‚Üí Keyword %*c% - Convert to camelCase (This will remove the spaces)

‚Ä¢ Add Width and Height
   Rename layer(s) with the width %W and height %H of a layer.

‚Ä¢ Find & Replace in Selected Layers
   Replace any word(s) or character(s) from selected layers.

plugins.name: Render Math
plugins.description:
The plugin takes your text and renders a frame with the properly formatted formula.

Usage:
1. Create text layer and insert LaTeX math equation into it.
2. Select text layer and run this plugin.

plugins.name: Replace Layers
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to easily swap one layer with another.

How to Use

  1. Select a layer in your Figma document.
  2. Click Set Source Layer
  3. Select another layer or layers that you want to replace
  4. Click Replace Layer(s)
  5. Keep Transforms: Check this box if the layers you're replacing are rotated or scaled, and you want to apply those transforms to the replacements. Note Scaling can only be determined if the layer you're replacing is an instance of a component.


New in 1.1: "Replace Image Fills"

If your source layer has one or more image fills, you can replace just the images on the destination layers. This is useful if you want to quickly set an image but don't want to lose the other fills or style treatments (which would get overridden if you naively copy-pasted a layer's properties)

Now you can also paste or drag images into the image well to use as a source.


Other notes:

Originally I wanted to be able to use the clipboard as the source for replacing a layer, but it's not possible in Figma. If you're using the Figma Desktop app, you can assign "Set Source Layer" to a keyboard shortcut as well.

If your source layer is a component, it will replace the target layer with an instance of that component.

The thumbnail that's generated when you set the source layer also acts as a quick export ‚Äî just drag it to your desktop to get a 2x resolution PNG of the source layer.

plugins.name: Replace Nodes
plugins.description:
Replace Nodes plugin replaces selected nodes with the copied node. Basically this plugin does paste over selection while removing the original selection.

How to use:
1. Select one node 
2. Right click -> Plugins -> Replace Nodes -> Copy Node
3. Select one or multiple nodes for replacement
4. Right click -> Plugins -> Replace Nodes -> Replace Selected Nodes

plugins.name: Reset Size
plugins.description:
1. Select one or several instances
2. Call the plugin
3. Done! All first-level instances inside selection is now reset to the size of their Master Components

The plugin will reset the size of all top-level instances in selection. Instances inside of the other instances will remain unaffected, as well as frames, groups, components or any other layers within the selection.

plugins.name: Reset Text Layer Name
plugins.description:
Ever end up wanting to reset your layer names, so the name reflects your text content? How about having to do that repeatedly for TONS of layers or components? üò∞ It's not possible to reset them all at once, UNTIL NOW!


"How do I get started?"


Easy! Just select any amount of text layers, and run the "Reset Text Layer Name" command.


Boom! You're done. üéâ


Donations

If you are feeling generous and would like to donate to me for providing this resource, head on over here (and thank you for any contribution!):

https://gum.co/resettextlayername

plugins.name: Resize Auto Layout
plugins.description:
How do I change the frame size with Auto Layout enabled? Temporarily disable it! This plugin will help make it easier.

How to use it:
- Select a frame.
- Reset Auto Layout.
- Return Auto Layout.

Usage example: twitter.com/AndreslavKozlov/status/1219714184121810945

Happy to help!

plugins.name: Resize Commands
plugins.description:
Inspired by the original "Resize Commands" plugin for Sketch (https://github.com/ajilderda/Sketch-Resize-Commands), this plugin lets you resize one or multiple layers with simple commands, by typing them like so: "l+50". You can also combine multiple commands by seperating them with a comma, like so: "l+50,r+20". If you check the box "Ignore Constraints", the elements will be resized without applying the individual constraints.

Developed at Syncier.

The following directions are supported at the moment:
l -> left
r -> right
t -> top
b -> bottom
w -> width (same as "right")
h -> height (same as "bottom")
x -> x-axis
y -> y-axis

The following operators are supported at the moment:
+ -> plus
- -> minus
= -> set x, y, w or h

You can apply the command by hitting "Enter".

plugins.name: Resize Layers
plugins.description:
üí° This plugin can change layers‚Äô size to the longest or shortest value.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

üí¨ How to use:

1. Select layers (Rectangle, Text, Instance ...)
2. Choose a option
- Shortest/Longest Width
- Shortest/Longest Height
- Smallest/Largest Size(Width & Height)
3. Speed up your workflow!

plugins.name: Resize to Frame
plugins.description:
Select items to resize them to their parent's size (Horizontally, Vertically or Both).

Default constraints (Left, Top) will be changed to (Left & Right, Top & Bottom).

Sources: https://github.com/neelts/figma-resize-to-frame

Subscribe to updates, discuss and report bugs in Telegram:
https://t.me/nfigma

plugins.name: Responsify ‚ö°Ô∏è
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to quickly test your designs across multiple device sizes.

1. Select any frame, component, or instance
2. Menu > ResponsifyÔ∏èÔ∏è ‚ö°Ô∏è > Select device sizes to test
3. Command + Shift + P to re-run

This code is open source: https://github.com/brianlovin/figma-responsify - contributions welcome!

plugins.name: Responsive
plugins.description:
Preview your responsive designs inside Figma!

How to
- Add all your layout frames part of a responsive design
- Add a frame to use as a responsive preview screen
- Start resizing the preview screen and see how your design behaves
- Click on the input frames in the plugin to test all edge cases 

Demo
https://twitter.com/eminsinani/status/1263883853283950592

Notes
- The preview screen changes frames based on the width of the input frames
- The width of an input frame is used as the minimum size for that layout

plugins.name: Respresso
plugins.description:
Integration plugin for respresso (https://respresso.io/), which is a collaborative asset management tool for multiplatform projects. You can send your digital assets (texts, images, colors, app icons) into Respresso with a single click.

Please read our documentation before you export assets from Figma: https://github.com/pontehu/respresso-figma

Respresso is free for the time beign and we don't want to change this offer in short time :) Don't waste your time! Use Respresso.

plugins.name: Restore Image Dimensions
plugins.description:
Restore original size of the image after it has been resized/cropped inside Figma


The plugin will reset the size of an image or any other selected object that has an image fill, to the original dimensions of the image.


You can reset several objects at a time. Clipping options will be switched back to ‚ÄûFill‚Äù. This plugin will not affect masks.

plugins.name: Retextifier
plugins.description:
Change multiple texts without having to click on each of them first

‚Ä¢ Plugin will find every visible unlocked text layer, and let you change all the texts in one take

‚Ä¢ Completely keyboard accessible ‚Äî select next field with TAB, change texts with ENTER, cancel with ESC

How to use: 
1. Select all the layers you want to be changed. If there is a Group or Frame within the selection, plugin will find every unlocked visible text layer inside of the selection. 

2. Call the plugin. List of founded text layers would be shown, so you can change all of them in one run. Navigate between fields with Tab / Shift+Tab. 

You also can paste multiple lines at once. Hold Shift while pasting, and every new line from copied text would be pasted into it's own field.

3. Click "Change" or press Enter. All changes would be applied. Mixed formatting for the layers that have been changed will be dropped.

Added in version 4:
‚Ä¢ Text layer coresponding with the currently active input now selected on canvas, so you can see more clearly which layer you will be changing.
‚Ä¢ Input orders now depends on position and nesting of the layers. If top leftmost object among selected id group all text layers inside of it will be placed in list of inputs first, and so on.
‚Ä¢ Now you can copy multiple layers from inputs. When you press Cmd+Shift+C texts from currently selected input and all inputs down from it will be copied to clipboard with new lines as a delimiters. 
‚Ä¢ Now tabs also works as a delimiters with multiline paste. With that you can copipaste rows from Goolge Sheets and other places.

See some details and video preview here: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1179063309280174081

plugins.name: Retro Snake
plugins.description:
Worked for too long? Needing a break? Unwind with a classic!

Bringing the retro game we all love into Figma, Snake!

How to Play:

Control the wriggly being with either "W+A+S+D" or Arrow Keys and grow it by feeding it with food. Yums~

As they all say, the longer the better, or is it?

In any case, when the game ends just press "ENTER" on the keyboard or click the "RESTART" button to respawn and beat your best score!

plugins.name: Retro Super Storm
plugins.description:
This plugin is ideal for team meetings. No need to buy new software, all of this already exists in Figma. Simple and self-explanatory UI will make your meetings easy and productive.

The plugin already has templates for Retrospective, Brainstorm and User Story Mapping. Also, the plugin has a built-in timer so you can follow the timing of each iteration.

How to use it:
1. Run the plugin.
2. Choose the template that you need for your meeting.
3. Hold the meeting in a comfy Figma environment.
The host has access to the timer, and time is available to everyone.

Tell me what other templates for teamwork you would like to see here. Stay in touch!

plugins.name: Reverse Layer Order
plugins.description:
This plugin will reverse the order of the selected layers.

Select 2 or more layers within the same parent and run the plugin.

plugins.name: Reverse Layers
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin Reverse Layers allows Figma users to reverse the order the selected layers.

1) Highlight the layers you want. The selected layers must all belong to the same parent layer.
2) Right click > Plugins > Reverse Layers
3) Voila!

You can hit CMD+Option+P to run the most recently ran plugin.

If you use this a lot please consider donating via PayPal to hoyoul+paypal@gmail.com or Venmo @hoyoul. Thanks!

plugins.name: RIG Buddy
plugins.description: Useful utilities for using the RIG Design System. Requires an invite to use.

plugins.name: Roller ¬∑ Design Linter ¬∑ Toybox
plugins.description:
Roller is the first ever Design Linter - giving you the power to automatically find and fix style inconsistencies in your files. Be confident every design you hand-off is 100% consistent with your Style Guide or Design System.

How to use Roller:
1 - Import or add your styles to the Roller Library
2 - Roller then automatically finds any inconsistencies (Errors) on the page that don‚Äôt match what is in your Library
3 - Replace the Error with one of your Library‚Äôs styles
4 - Rinse & repeat to reach 100% consistency

Lint in the following categories:
‚Ä¢ Colors - Quickly fix the 50 (or 5,000) shades of gray that are lurking in your designs.

‚Ä¢ Text - If a subtle line-height or letter-spacing is off, Roller will pick them up and get you back on system.

‚Ä¢ Borders - Roller lets you add the width and colors of your borders - making it easy to find any rogue input field or card.

‚Ä¢ Shadows - Roller gives you superhuman eyes - making it possible to detect subtle differences in shadow blurs or x, y offsets. 

‚Ä¢ Radiuses - Be confident that any button, card, input etc. has the correct border-radiuses applied.

Keep your team in-sync:
Roller lets you store and share your Library with teammates. Make sure everyone on your team has up-to-date resources and styles when linting.

Documentation and chat support (we‚Äôre always here to help!):
https://www.trytoybox.com/help-center-categories/roller

support@toyboxsystems.com

More info and pretty pictures at:
https://www.trytoybox.com/roller

plugins.name: Rotate Copies
plugins.description:
Create rotated copies of any element


‚úÖ Rotate around center

‚úÖ Rotate around origin

‚úÖ Rotate around a custom center point

plugins.name: Rotate Each
plugins.description:
Select one or multiple objects and rotate them randomly around their center point. This plugin was inspired by the same feature in Adobe Illustrator. 

---

I will hopefully add a UI component in the future that lets you specify a range you want to rotate by.

plugins.name: Rotate Origin
plugins.description:
Want to rotate an object around an arbitrary point? With Rotate Origin, it is possible!

How to use:
‚óâ Set the angle of rotation;
‚óâ Set the offset relative to the upper left corner;
‚óâ Rotate!

Examples:
- Angle: 30; Offset X: 0%; Offset Y: 100% - will rotate the object 30 degrees relative to the lower left corner.
- Angle: 45; Offset X: 0; Offset Y: 0 - rotates the object 45 degrees relative to the upper left corner.
- Angle: 90; Offset X: 100; Offset Y: -100 - rotates the object 90 degrees relative to a point located 100 degrees to the left and 100 degrees above the top left corner.

‚óâ Demonstration of work: twitter.com/AndreslavKozlov/status/1204150344864976896

plugins.name: Roto
plugins.description:
Roto extrudes and rotates shapes in 3D. 

To use Roto select a shape, run Roto, rotate your object by dragging the preview and play with Roto's properties. A shape with a stroke creates a wireframe. For solid shaded objects give your shapes a solid fill color. If you add an additional fill color you can customize the front color of your object.

Built with Three.js

plugins.name: Round it! (by 8px, 10px, ...)
plugins.description:
Round all properties to the nearest multiplier of 8, 10, or your custom value! This is very useful when you are working with the 8px Grid, or other grid systems.


You can:

  • Round the height, the width, and also the X- and Y-position of anything you want (Rectangles, Images, etc...)
  • Rounding the properties of multiple items at once is supported!


‚Äî


Feature requests? üòä Questions?

Just hit me on Twitter (@madebyfabian), via mail (hello@madebyfabian.com) or via an Issue on GitHub.


‚Äî


Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Fabian B. in Nuremberg, Germany. Want to support me? Would appreciate that very much! http://buymeacoff.ee/madebyfabian

plugins.name: RTL PLZ
plugins.description:
Write RTL text in figma with less tears.
Supports multilayers revert, symbols and reset layers.
No need external editor for short text, just edit in place and run RTL PLZ Revert.

How to use:
- Create text layer > enter rtl text > Run RTL PLZ Revert
- Create/Select text layer > Run RTL PLZ Editor > Type/Paste text in the plugin window
- If the width of textbox is not auto, Run RTL PLZ Update Wrap after textbox resize.

plugins.name: RTL support
plugins.description:
Flip RTL languages like hebrew and arabic.
Can deal with mixed content and will adjust font and textbox size so you can understand wrapping.

Instructions:

1. Select a text layer
2. Run the plugin
3. Edit the text, text will change as you type
**** new *****
4. You can select any other text field on stage and edit it as you wish. 
5. If you resize the field, the text will keep its original wrapping. use the refresh button to sort the wrapping again

Have fun. Hopefully this will get Figma to support this from the properties window....

plugins.name: RTLit
plugins.description:
"RTLit" is a Figma plugin that converts the Arabic/Persian/Urdu text into readable format as Figma currently does not support RTL languages.

Behind the scenes it reverses the characters and does some other things to turn RTL gobbledigook into readable text. It has its limitations (see Known Issues below).

## How To

1. Copy Arabic/Persian/Urdu text from the source i.e. a web browser or other design software such as Adobe Illustrator etc.
2. Paste it into the Figma Text Box. Make sure you have selected a font that supports Perso-Arabic letters.
3. Select Figma Text Box (You can select more than one at a time as well).
4. `Right Click > Plugins > RTLit`
5. Done.

> Make sure you retain the original text somewhere. If you transform the Figma Text Box, you will have to redo the steps mentioned above.

## Known Issues

1. LTR words such as numbers or english text if broken in two lines might create problems in formatting.
2. There might be more unknown issues feel free to report them here (https://github.com/ahmednooor/RTLit/issues). Behind the scenes, it reverses the characters sort of like it is mentioned here (https://help.figma.com/article/70-writing-in-other-languages) in "Use Right-To-Left (RTL) languages" section on forums.

plugins.name: Safely Delete Components
plugins.description:
When you delete a component, it can be still used in your mockups. On the other hand, unused components clutter up your document.

Safely Delete Components does two things:

üóë  Safe Delete

1. Select a component you want to delete
2. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Safe Delete (or ‚åò+/ > "Safe Delete")
3. This component will be deleted if there are no instances of it in the document

üßπ  Delete Unused Components

1. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Delete Unused Components (or ‚åò+/ > "Delete Unused Components")
2. The plugin will find components with no instances and delete them

When the plugin finishes its work, you'll see which components have been deleted.

Be aware that this plugin can be very slow with large documents, especially when working with unused components.

plugins.name: Same Text Generator
plugins.description: Generate the same text with one click.

plugins.name: SamPonent
plugins.description:
This is a simple Plugin that you can use to quickly change the element in your design.

To use it, you just need to pick a component, then replace other element by attach its instance.

Designed & developed by Sam Liu, from Huemen.

plugins.name: Saved Selections
plugins.description:
Save, restore, and combine your carefully-crafted selections.

How to use:

1. Make a selection (one or more elements)
2. Click "Save Selection" and give it a name (or not)
3. To restore your selection at any time, click it in the list. Hold SHIFT while clicking and your saved selection will be combined with whatever you have currently selected.

I hope you find it useful. Feedback appreciated!

plugins.name: Scale
plugins.description:
Scale any frame, it‚Äôs contents, and all effects to any defined width or height.

Features:
‚Ä¢ Multi-Select ‚Üí Select as many or as few frames and layers as you'd like.
‚Ä¢ Scale by Width or Height

plugins.name: Screeener for Figma
plugins.description:
Plugin to create mockups of your project's screens.

Inspired by the Screeener app.


Live demo:

https://twitter.com/EdgardKozlowski/status/1256263229602398208

plugins.name: Scripter
plugins.description:
Speed up your workflow or experiment with the Figma API through scripts. Backed by the same editor infrastructure used by Microsoft VS Code, Scripter provides a fun and safe environment for playing with the Figma plugin API without the need to write actual plugins. Just type and run.


-> Automatically saves scripts on your computer.

-> Ability to save, load and share scripts in Figma files.

-> Guides you through navigating the API with code completion.

-> Immediate feedback of output and errors.

-> Comes with examples and a copy of the Figma plugin API definitions.

-> await/async at the top level.

-> Async timers with timer().

-> Animations with animate().

-> Many convenient functions built-in, like node type guards.


Note: Currently does not work with Safari

plugins.name: Search
plugins.description:
Navigate across your Figma document by its text content. Also you can tag arbitrary nodes of your document with your custom tags and navigate based on this tags

You can navigate to any page of your current document.
If you have a small document, you can turn on "Reindex on search" and always search based on the most resent search content. Otherwise, you can index your text document manually and then instantly search, using saved index.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

When opened plugin window:
Index your document using "Reindex" button 
or turn on "Index on search" toggle.

Then enter text fragment you want to look for to the "Search" input
and push Enter.

Then all the results appear underneath search control and 
clicking them you will be navigated to the corresponding node in your document.

If you want to add tags to your document nodes than you should open "tags" tab. 
There you can create tags with "Add tags" text field.
Select some group of nodes and their tags will be shown under "Current tags" caption.

If you want to search by tags navigate back to "search" tab and click on the corresponding tag button.

plugins.name: Search & Focus
plugins.description:
Search everything in Figma with autocomplete. Focusing on your results - just choose item in lists.

You can search all nodes in a page like text, component, group, frame etc. When choosing node in results list you will be moved to its location, and the node will fit into the page as much as possible on the screen.

Functionality:

‚úîÔ∏è Searching with autocomplete
‚úîÔ∏è Searching with case sensitive
‚úîÔ∏è Focusing on Node
‚úîÔ∏è Match Whole Word

plugins.name: Select all instances
plugins.description: Select all instances from all components.

plugins.name: Select by Font
plugins.description:
Figma‚Äôs Selection Color tool but for Fonts and Styles.

Easily view all the distinct fonts used in the current selection. Then, select all text nodes of a similar font. 

WHY THIS PLUGIN WILL CHANGE YOUR WORKFLOW
This plugin removes the pain of finding and selecting text nodes.

Designers relate a text node with its purpose - heading, caption, label, warning etc. A well crafted design system has font style names that match the purpose of the style. Thus, font types and style names are the best way to get to a text node. This plugin makes that possible.

In our beta testing, designers who use this plugin use it so often and after a while can‚Äôt imagine their workflow without it. The plugin is designed to be a narrow and vertical dialog so that it can be kept open while you are working on your designs.

HOW TO USE THE PLUGIN

STEP 1
Select a frame or a group of frames

STEP 2
Run the plugin to see the distinct list of fonts used in the selection

STEP 3
Click on the Font or Style Name to select ALL the text nodes that match that style.

STEP 4
If you make any changes to font or style, then refresh to update the font list.

COMING SOON
Cycle through text node selection
Auto refresh font list after changes are made
Spell check on text nodes

plugins.name: Select Inverse for Real
plugins.description:
Inverts your selection within the context of the parent group/frame. 

Currently, Figma's Select Inverse command selects all objects, even those outside of a group. Select Inverse for Real lets you achieve the same result but stops at your parent group or frame. 

‚Ñπ How to use: 

Select one or more objects.
Run "Select Inverse for Real" command.

In the future, Figma will allow custom keyboard shortcuts for plugins to make this a menu-free experience, so watch for updates! :)

plugins.name: Select Layers
plugins.description:
Select layers based on name, type, or similarity.


Select Layers by Name

Selects layers that partially or exactly match the given name.


Select Layers by Type

Selects layers of a particular type:

  • Component
  • Instance Layer
  • Frame
  • Group
  • Slice
  • Vector Layer
  • Rectangle
  • Line
  • Ellipse
  • Polygon
  • Star
  • Boolean Group
  • Image
  • Text Layer


Select Mask Layers / Hidden Layers / Locked Layers / Layers With Exports

Selects layers with the specified attribute.


Select Parent Layers / Root Layers

Selects layers at the specified hierarchy.


Select Similar Layers

Selects layers with one or more attributes that are identical to the one currently-selected layer.


Reset Plugin

Resets all settings to their defaults.


With the exception of Select Similar Layers, all commands make a sub-selection within the currently-selected layers, or creates a new selection of layers if the selection is empty.

plugins.name: Select Parent
plugins.description:
Select Parent, lets you quickly select the parent object of whatever you have selected. It even works when you have multiple layers selected. 

To use the plugin simply select at least one layer that is nested (either in a frame or group) and then run the plugin. The parent layers of whatever you had selected should now be selected, making it quick and easy to move, make adjustments, etc.

See a quick demo video here: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1163492927559077889

plugins.name: Select Similar
plugins.description:
Selects canvas nodes by common features, such as:
‚Äì Relative Layer Position.
‚Äì Layer Type.
‚Äì Font Name.
‚Äì Fill.
‚Äì Stroke.
‚Äì Size.
‚Äì Locked.
‚Äì Visible.
‚Äì Text Content.
‚Äì Missing Fonts.
‚Äì Multiple Fonts.

Order of actions:
- Select the comparison parameters.
- Select the sample layer (multiple layers are possible).
- Select the group(s) / frame (s) to search in. If you don't select it, the search will be global.
- Select!

Demonstration: twitter.com/AndreslavKozlov/status/1211573349127720960

plugins.name: Selection2Page
plugins.description: Move the selection to the new page created automatically.

plugins.name: Semantic Color Sync
plugins.description:
It‚Äôs easy for developers and designers to know exactly what color to use when your colors have semantic names. Primary600? That name doesn't mean much. PrimaryButtonLabel? That's clear as can be.

This plugin makes it simple to maintain a collection of semantically named colors that derive their color from your base palette. Not only does this allow you to increase clarity of usage, it also lays the foundation necessary for theming within your apps. 

For more details on why you should implement your colors this way, read this blog post:
https://dev.to/ynab/a-semantic-color-system-the-theory-hk7

Using Semantic Color Sync is simple. First, create your base palette. For each base palette color, add a consistent prefix, such as ‚Äú.palette/‚Äù

Next, create a series of semantically named colors. In the description for each semantically named color, add the base palette color it derives from (including the prefix). For example: ‚Äú.palette/primary600‚Äù

Next, when you decide to change your primary hue from blue to bright pink (good choice, btw), the Semantic Color Sync plugin will automatically search through every semantically named color and update their color to match the updates made in your base palette. 

No need to update things by hand... Ugh. Just tweak your base palette and run this plugin to propagate the changes throughout all of your semantically named colors!

And again, if you‚Äôre curious why this is useful, this blog post has it all laid out: 
https://dev.to/ynab/a-semantic-color-system-the-theory-hk7

plugins.name: Send to Components Page
plugins.description:
If you prefer to keep your components on a separate page and are tired of carrying them manually, this plugin is for you.

1. Select any number of Components. Frame, group, or just group selection will also work.

2. Call up the plugin. All components from the selection will be transferred to a separate Components page and placed in a special Unsorted Components frame. The places occupied by the components will be substituted by their instances.

The plugin has two independent commands to choose from:

Send to components page
(For a quick search, print snc)

When this command is invoked, the Components are sent to a separate page while staying on the same page.

Send to components page and go to
(for a quick search, print sngo)

When this command is invoked, after moving components the focus is moved to the components page, and all newly transferred components are selected.

All components are placed in a special frame only for predictability, and you are welcome to extract the characters from the frame and organize them as you wish. See it as a predictable arrival point for new components.

Although the presence of components in the frame will not prevent further calls (i.e. you can securely call the plugin several times in a row), the plugin looks up at the contents of the frame every time, so for better performance, it makes sense to keep it as empty as possible.

A few details:

- If you already have a page named "Components" or "Symbols", the plugin will use it to place its frame. If the page doesn't exist plugin will create it and use afterward.
- If the page or frame has been deleted, the plugin will recreate the new ones at the next call
- You can rename the components page or frame as you wish.

plugins.name: Send to Top
plugins.description:
Take any selection and send it to the top of the layer stack.

It is useful for unnesting elements that you want to reside above all of your frames/artboards.

Open-sourced on Github:
https://github.com/thomas-lowry/send-to-top/

plugins.name: Simple Table Generator
plugins.description:
Table Generator

---
Instructions

source data from your spreadsheet.

Step 2:
Paste your content into the first input box.

Step 3:
Select the width of your table. Please note this plugin will match the number of columns you
have in your original data and equally place them in the width selected.

Step 4:
Customize your font colour, font size, font family, letter spacing and line height if necessary.

Step 5:
Select (Yes/No) if you have included a header in the first row.

Step 6:
Click button to generate table.

---
Additional Information
This plugin do not read .csv file. Please copy and paste your data in.

All the text are left aligned. 

A line will be generated at the bottom of each row. If you select to indicate header is included
in the first row. The first row will not have line under it. Lines generated have the same
colour as text.

---
Get in touch:
This project started as my current workplace needed something like this. This eliminates any stress 
of manually adding information into Figma. We want this to be available to the community. So
if you have any feedback on how to make this plug in better, please shoot me an email 
chao@reflektor.digital

https://bitbucket.org/reflektor-digital/figma-simple-table-plugin/src/master/

plugins.description:

plugins.name: Simplify
plugins.description:
Simplifies vector paths by automatically reducing and rearranging their line segments. 

Select one or more vector paths you want to  simplify and run the plugin ‚Äî it will  simplify the selected paths and they will look smoother.

The plugin uses De Casteljau's algorithm to rasterize the vector paths first, and then applies Ramer‚ÄìDouglas‚ÄìPeucker algorithm to simplify them.

Sources can be found at: https://github.com/zserge/figma-simplify-path

plugins.name: simplify path
plugins.description:
https://github.com/zserge/figma-simplify-path

A small plugin that simplifies vector paths in Figma.

It can be applied to any vector nodes. The plugin iterates through all segments, renders Bezier curves using De Casteljau's algorithm, then reduces the number of points in the lines using Douglas-Peucker algorithm and converts resulting points into new Bezier curves.

This results in smoother and simpler lines, which can be especially helpful when using Pencil tool.

plugins.name: Sitemap
plugins.description:
Create maps of your site. Crawl links. Recursive & fast.

________

üåê  How does it work ?

‚Ä¢ type/paste your site url
‚Ä¢ click on "Create Map"
‚Ä¢ a Sitemap is displayed on your main canvas, listing all links found in the html source of 

‚Ä¢ for further exploration : select a group with a link, and click on "Create map" again. A new map is then created, with all the links found in this new page.
‚Ä¢ Links that are found on both pages are shown with a reduced opacity, so you can easily spot "new" links, that are present only on the sub page.

________

üß∞  Options

‚Ä¢ you can sort urls alphabetically or by url length
‚Ä¢ you can choose to only display links that contain a specific word/url (using "Contains..")
‚Ä¢ .. or you can exclude links based on a word/url (using  "Without..")
‚Ä¢ you can also search for specific word/url (by selecting one or multiple frames, typing the word then click "search")
‚Ä¢ not necessary, but I suggest you choose an empty page, with a background color set to #3C6DD3, when you use this plugin

________

üì∏  Screenshots (option)

‚Ä¢ you can automatically display screenshots of the given urls
‚Ä¢ to do so, this plugin uses free api API Flash
‚Ä¢ please note that I am not affiliated with API Flash

In order to use the screenshot option, you will need to get a free account on https://apiflash.com/ (free up to 100 screenshots per month). Then, just paste your API key inside the right input, then select "With screenshots"

________

üóíÔ∏è  Notes 

This plugin is a WIP. Besides, it may not be as efficient as dedicated SEO tools, but can be useful (I hope!) to get a quick view of how your site is organised. If you find bugs, or if you find this plugin usefull and have suggestions on how to improve it, please feel free to contact me.

NB : this plugin uses cors-anywhere.herokuapp.com, which can sometimes affect its responsiveness.

plugins.name: skale
plugins.description:
Scale your layers (any layer!) to a specificed width, height or scale value including all properties (strokes, etc). Imagine the scale tool (K) with the power of the properties panel (specify width, height or scale value).

Currently Skale only works on instances of components, not on the master component itself. In future releases we'll hopefully see Skale working across all layers.

plugins.name: SkewDat
plugins.description:
It‚Äôs stupid simple, and yes you absolutely needs this! 

Let‚Äôs be honest we‚Äôve all at least once tried to skew things up a notch... and admit it, whatever hack you tried was just  a dirty hack. Well now you can just say SkewDat! With our  plugin you can skew anything & everything in sight within the comfort of everyone's favorite design program, ehm ehm Figma. Skew settling for anything less than perfect! We here at Unfold feed off perfection (we will literally die if we don't eat enough perfection) so you know this plugin will be amazing. ‚Ä®‚Ä®Hopping to Illustrator, Sketch or using other hacks? 
Hah, SkewDat!

Plug-in features:

Upcoming features:

plugins.name: Slicer
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to make easier to slice multiple objects.

How to use:
1. Run Slicer.
2. Select one or more layers you want to Slice.
3. Choose to set the slice size with padding or total size.
4. Click Slice and the layers will be sliced and grouped.

Feature requests and support:
Feel free to ping me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/exclama

plugins.name: Slide Show
plugins.description:
Slide Show is a simple yet powerful utility that lets you turn any page of unlinked frames into a slide show presentation that you control while others watch in real time.


It's easy:


  1. Rename your frames in alphabetical order (numbers appear before letters).
  2. Turn off visibility for frames you don't want to show.
  3. Share your prototype link or embed to viewers.
  4. Start the Slide Show plugin and be amazed!


Navigate from frame to frame, or restart your slide show. (To start from a specific frame, select it before running the plugin.)


Keynote Live and PowerPoint Present Live are neat, but Figma's now a viable alternative, thanks to this plugin.


  • Ditch screen shares and present crisp graphics!
  • Embed your slide show anywhere!
  • Multiple frame sizes? Easy peasy!
  • Forget complex transitions. Less is more!
  • Live editing of slides? Yes!


For best results, use a Figma prototype link (or embed) with these parameters: scaling=contain and hide-ui=1. This ensures viewers see content at the largest size possible with minimum distraction.


Important: When using Slide Show, you must have the Starting Frame in the prototype tab grayed out and set to None. The plugin will detect if this isn't the case, and share directions on how to fix.


Tip: For presenter notes or other content that's not viewable by readers, simply place them on the background canvas. Just make sure it's not in a frame.


While anyone can use this plugin, it was built especially for LexGo Work to easily control guided presentations designed in Figma.

plugins.name: Smart Cloner
plugins.description:
Make multiple renamed copies of components, frames or other layers in seconds.

‚Ä¢ Choose direction with command and create any amount of copies at a time
‚Ä¢ Completely keyboard accessible: name and create all of the copies in one approach to the keyboard.
‚Ä¢ The part after the last ‚Äú/‚Äù is preselected automatically (use cmd/ctrl + a to select all if needed)
‚Ä¢ All copies would be selected and conveniently placed right under the prototype layer
‚Ä¢ Regulate distance between copies. Plugin remembers last value for the next time.

How to use:
1. Select one layer that you want to copy. Works with Components, Frames and other types of layers.
2. Call the plugin. The plugin has 4 different commands for cloning in all 4 directions.
3. Name your copies. Use tab for creating another copy, so you can name all of them in one approach to the keyboard.
4. (Optional) Hit Shift+Tab to focus on Shift input, then type the desired distance between the copies. The plugin will remember that value next time.
4. Hit Enter to create your copies.

Also, visit this thread for video demo: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1169334638805958658

plugins.name: Smart Data
plugins.description:
Smart data inserts data from a JSON file or random data according to the layer name.

How to insert data from JSON:
1. Prepare a JSON file
2. Drop the file into the plugin window
3. Rename layers on a canvas according to the JSON file
4. Select a frame
5. Paste data

To place an image on the canvas you need to insert to the JSON file URL to the image. Images insert only in rectangle and ellipse types of nodes.

How to insert a random data
1. Rename your text layers. For example, to insert the random email address you need to rename your text layer "email"
2. Select a frame
3. Run plugin

Smart Data supports next random fields:
name
email
weekday
phone
movie
address
time
email
date
food
number
price
emoji

Document with example https://www.figma.com/file/Y9WzkjOzCw4dpNjNLODixY/Smart-Data-example?node-id=0%3A1

plugins.name: Smart Text
plugins.description:
With Smart text you can create custom text expressions with special tokens connected to the properties of your layers. Ôøº
Tokens grant you access to layer‚Äôs properties, such as size, position, transforms, colorsÔøº, fonts, styles, names, effects and much more. 

After you make changes on the connected layers, the plugin will update the expressions content with up-to-date data from the layers.

Documenting design has never been easier: Create and maintain automatic documentations, style-guides, brand manuals, dev specs or any design templates, right in Figma.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
ÔøºÔøºÔøºÔøº
HOW TO CREATE SMART EXPRESSIONS

1. Access the plugin and select the Insert Tab.
2. Select at least one layer to connect on the canvas. Plugin will detect your selection and will show the name of the selected layer, or ‚ÄòMixed‚Äô if more than one layer is selected. 
3. Add tokens on the expression input by clicking the items in the Tokens list. The plugin will give you a live preview of the result for the first selected item. 
4. Create a custom expression by mixing plain text and tokens inside the Expression field.
5. Click Insert to add a text layer containing the expression, on top of each selected layer.

Note: Editing the content or tokens of an expression after the insertion is not currently supported. You‚Äôll have to add a new expression with desired values.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
ÔøºÔøºÔøºÔøº
HOW TO SYNC SMART EXPRESSIONS

1. Access the plugin and select the Resolve Tab.
2. Select a scope from the Picker. You can choose to resolve the current Selection, Current Page or the Entire Document.
3. Click Resolve to proceed. The plugin will detect all available expressions in the Scope and update the content based on the current layer properties. 

Note: Expressions connected to missing or deleted layers will be ignored and tagged as Broken. Reconnection is not supported currently. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

HOW TO CUSTOMIZE TOKENS OUTPUT VALUE

Some tokens allow their output value to be customized. These tokens use square-brackets in their name. You can customize their output by changing the value inside. 

Colors: [HEX] -> [RGB]
Date: [MM.DD.YYYY] -> [hh.mm.ss]

---

Available Color Outputs (case-insensitive)
HEX, RGB, CSS, HSL

Available Date Output (case-sensitive)
See full list of formats here: https://devhints.io/moment

plugins.name: Smartling
plugins.description:
Without leaving Figma, you can submit prototypes for professional, machine or pseudo translation to get the gist for what the localized environment will look like before you put your ‚Äúpencil down‚Äù on a project.


When you start translating and localizing your content as soon as the design prototypes are available, the entire process for shipping new product gets faster. Smartling‚Äôs localization plugin for Figma seamlessly connects your designers with Smartling‚Äôs translation service in just one click.


You prototype user experiences in English because that‚Äôs the primary language of your product or digital environment. You check to see if text fits within buttons, how layouts change with different devices and make design decisions based on your preferred user experience. Why not do this for your global user base, too?


Product Documentation:


Install - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360048715133-Figma-Plugin-Installation-and-


Setup Pseudotranslation - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047993254-Pseudotranslation-in-


FigmaSubmit for Translation - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047994174-Submit-Translations-to-

plugins.name: Social Media Image

Sort selected Frames or Layers by names.

plugins.name: Sort Layers
plugins.description:
Sort layers by name or position.


Sort Layers by Name

Sort the selected layers in alphabetical order.


Sort Layers by X Position

Sort the selected layers by their X position.


Sort Layers by Y Position

Sort the selected layers by their Y position.


Smart Sort Layers

Sort the selected layers by their X and Y position while maintaining their relative stacking order on the page.


Reverse Layer Sort Order

Reverse the sort order of the selected layers.


Randomize Layer Sort Order

Randomize the sort order of the selected layers.


Sort Pages

Sort the pages of the current document in alphabetical order.

plugins.name: Sorter
plugins.description:
A plugin for sorting/reordering layers.

‚Ä¢ Sort by Position ( Left, Right -> Top, Bottom)
‚Ä¢ Sort Alphabetical Ascending (A -> Z)
‚Ä¢ Sort Alphabetical Descending (Z -> A)
‚Ä¢ Reverse order
‚Ä¢ Randomize order

How it works:
Sorter will take your selection and sort the layers using the ordering of your choice, relative to each items parent. This means you can have a mixed selection of top level frames, and child elements and the plugin will always sort them without throwing errors.

If you only want to sort children of your selection, enable the "Sort Children Only" option. Sorter will remember your selection for the next time you run the plugin in that file.

Open sourced on Github:
https://github.com/thomas-lowry/sorter

plugins.name: Spacers
plugins.description:
Smarter Autolayouts with Spacers


> Add custom spaces between component

> Hide and show spacers in one clic

> Create new autolayouts in seconds

> Custom sizes

> Custom colors


A plugin by the UX 82 Team > Elsa, Arnaud, Bertrand, Christophe, Guillaume, Olivier


> Add custom spaces between component


Select the component where to add a spacer.

Choose your direction

Choose your spacer size

And the spacer is added to your design


> Hide and show spacers in one clic


Just switch to see spacers or not

The state is saved in the document so you can share it clean. Anyone with the plugin can show them back.


> Create new autolayouts in seconds


If you add a spacer in a direction that does not fit with the parent autolayout, Spacers plugin smartly adds you a new autolayout.


It also works with multi selection in a same frame : select at least the first and last element you need to move with a spacer and a inner autolayout will be created.

plugins.name: Spacing Manager
plugins.description:
The Purpose

I think we all know that sometimes designers making different spacings between the elements. In some cases, we have 15px spacing, and in another place, 14px. It's hard always to update all these spacings manually.


With the help of auto layout, we can resolve this problem. Just turn on the auto layout feature with zero spacing between the elements and use "spacers" between.


There are different ways, but I prefer to use the 8-Point Grid System. You can use premade "spacers" from the public library (https://www.figma.com/c/file/809152234949654615/Spacings) and place them between the elements. In that case, you will make sure that the spacings between the components are consistent.


How it works

Add the library https://www.figma.com/c/file/809152234949654615/Spacings or have own symbols that have "$spacing" word in the name;

Use them when needed

If you want to hide them, select a parent frame and run the plugin. It will look for all spacers that were used on the frame and will set zero opacity

If you want to show spacers back, just rerun the plugin. If the first spacer on the row will have zero opacity, it will set 100% for all spacers found on the selected frame.


Pro tip

You can use smart spacing prediction feature! Here is how it works https://twitter.com/faridsabitov/status/1281697269948067845


Pro tip

You can set "cmd"+"option"+"H" hotkey via system preferences in Mac to toggle spacers visibility quickly. You can read more about setting the hotkeys in Figma here: https://hustle.bizongo.in/custom-shortcuts-for-figma-8c93f3bc9ca2

plugins.name: Spagett!
plugins.description:
Spagett is here to spook you! Get ready to see Spagett everywhere.

When executing the plugin there's two possible scenarios:

1. Some layers is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every selected layer.
2. No layer is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every layer that already has a fill in the page.

(Some context https://youtu.be/uyh3C1xDT3Y)

The code for this plugin is open sourced at GitHub
https://github.com/aarongarciah/figma-spagett

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Aar√≥n Garc√≠a
https://twitter.com/aarongarciah

plugins.name: Spell Inspector
plugins.description:
Spell Inspector helps to accurately find and correct spelling errors for the English language. It will correct your typos and misused words in minutes.

The plugin checks the current Page for spelling errors and offers corresponding suggestions to correct them.

How to use it: 

1. Open your file
2. Run the Spell Inspector plugin from the menu -> Plugins -> Spell Inspector
3. Word, Occurrence Count, and Suggestion tags will be shown. By clicking on a particular word its position will be highlighted.
4. If you want to change all occurrences at the same time click on any of the suggestion tags.
5. And if you want to check out more suggestions or a custom replacement of words, click on the info icon where you can see each frame name or group name where the misspelled word is located. 
6. By clicking on the frame name, you will be redirected to word position in a particular frame.

Voila! Everything is checked and good to go!  

We hope this plugin becomes a useful tool for you. Let us know your feedback on devtools@logicwind.com

plugins.name: Spellchecker
plugins.description:
Spellchecker uses the Yandex API.Speller helps to find and correct spelling errors in Russian, Ukrainian or English text. Language speller models include hundreds of millions of words and phrases.

The plugin checks the selected text layer for spelling errors and offers to correct them.

Important. It is recommended to work with small texts.

plugins.name: SPELLL - Spell Checking for Figma
plugins.description:
This plugin gives Figma a spell-checking super power similar to that of Google Docs. ‚ö°‚ú®
It constantly checks your Figma document for any spelling errors and let's you fix them with a single click.
You have worked really hard to create that perfect UI. Don‚Äôt let a silly typo ruin it. 
Use SPELLL and avoid those embarrassing mistaks. üòâ

Usage:

1. Open SPELLL - Spell check for Figma plugin.
2. If it finds any spelling mistakes you will be able to fix them by either clicking on the Accept button or ignore the suggestion by clicking on the Ignore button. Click the three dots next to the Accept button for more options.
3. That is it, if you keep SPELLL open it will monitor your document and give you real time spelling suggestions.

New Features:

‚ñ∂ Ability to fix or ignore multiple instances of a typo with a single click.

‚ñ∂ Ability to add words such as your brand name to your dictionary to stop them from being reported as spelling mistakes.

‚ñ∂ Detects new text layers being added and spell check them in real time.

‚ñ∂ Ability to pick from multiple suggestions.

‚ñ∂ Zooms into and selects the current text layer with a typo to provide you with more context.

‚ñ∂ Massive performance improvement while working on large Figma files.

‚ñ∂ Remembers your prefered language.

Supported languages:

SPELLL supports 43 languages from around the world. 
These are the supported languages
Asturian, Belarusian, Breton, Catalan, Catalan (Valencian), Chinese, Danish, Dutch, English, English (Australian), English (Canadian), English (GB), English (New Zealand), English (South African), English (US), Esperanto, French, Galician, German, German (Austria), German (Germany), German (Swiss), Greek, Italian, Japanese, Khmer, Persian, Polish, Portuguese, Portuguese (Angola preAO), Portuguese (Brazil), Portuguese (Mo√ßambique preAO), Portuguese (Portugal), Romanian, Russian, Simple German, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Tagalog, Tamil & Ukrainian.

It is impossible for me to test all these languages so please do let me know if your prefered language is not working as expected through Twitter https://twitter.com/tkmadeit or email support@spelll.design

Why do I need a license key?

I pay a monthly subscription to run and maintain the spell checking software and server, protecting my own API by making you request for a license key helps me reduce abuse on the API and hefty monthly subscription fees.

Your email address will ONLY be used for sending you information regarding SPELLL, such as your license key and feature updates.

Privacy
SPELLL does NOT store anything from your Figma files, except for the words you add to your dictionary. This way when you use SPELLL on a new device those words will not be spell checked again.

plugins.name: Split Shape
plugins.description:
Split your shapes, text layers, groups and frames into multiple instances. It's useful for when you need to generate columns and/or rows in a specific container without having to calculate the size manually. 

‚Ä¢ Works with normal shapes, text layers, groups and frames
‚Ä¢ Add gutter in between those instances.
‚Ä¢ Add margin at the front and back.
‚Ä¢ Existing styles from the original shape (color, background image, etc) is preserved in all instances.

Ideas & improvement:
[‚úì] Remember previously entered option values
[‚úì] No need to re-open plugin if you forgot to make a selection
[   ] Turn those boring textfields into nicer numeric steppers
[   ] Improve UI with icon / visual representation of each option
[   ] ...?

Tweet at @gaddafirusli if you have other suggestions and ideas.

See usage examples & updates in my Twitter thread: https://twitter.com/gaddafirusli/status/1164894899453382656

-------------------------------
This plugin is 100% inspired by kupe517's Sketch plugin of the same name: https://github.com/kupe517/sketch-split-shape

plugins.name: Split Vectors
plugins.description:
Tired of copying vector parts to customize them?
Try this plugin to speedup your work!

You can Split Vectors:

‚û° by Fills. Select Vector with more than one fill region.
‚û° by Shapes. Select Vector with more than one separated shapes inside.
‚û° by Segments. Select Vector with more than one segment inside.

Known issues:
Due to API limitations, it is currently impossible to get all possible fill areas automatically after filling a Vector, so you need to manually add fills with Paint Bucket (B) before splitting.
But soon I'll do it on the plugin side üòú

Artwork inspired by:
üñº Kazimir Malevich, Spotrsmeny, 1931

Dedicated to my beloved wife Sofia üíñ

plugins.name: Spokestack
plugins.description:
Design user experiences that integrate voice as an interaction.

Add interactions as normal to your prototype, then add a voice interaction using Spokestack.

See https://spokestack.io for more on how to add voice to apps and websites.

plugins.name: Spotlight
plugins.description:
Light plugin for fast navigation in your project. Find and jump to any Page, Frame, Component, Layer. That's it!

With the Recents section, you can quickly switch between 2-5 things to which you jumped before. Use arrow keys and return (enter on Win) to move inside the project without lifting your hands from the keyboard.

Pro tip: launch plugin with Run last plugin shortcut ‚å• ‚åò P.

I believe you are quite smart to remember the names of layers and pages. So what is the point of losing your mind finding them in the layers panel, right?

plugins.name: Sprinkle
plugins.description:
Make it rain with confetti

1. Select your pieces of confetti (make sure they're inside of a Frame)
2. Enter the amount of confetti, and whether to randomize the opacity and rotation
3. üéâ

Note: Your selection must be inside of a parent Frame to randomize the placement of confetti

plugins.name: Squiggly
plugins.description:
Rooted in a love of generative design, Squiggly generates unique squiggles as complex or as simple as you might like. 

Create 1-500 squiggles at a time. Each squiggle creates a stroke that is completely editable after it's creation.

plugins.name: Stacks
plugins.description:
Stacks provide extensive, semi-automated control over the spacing, direction and alignment of layers. 

How-to:
Stacks are applied to a parent Frame or Component, and affect their child layers. To create a Stack, select either a single Frame or Component, or two or more layers, and choose ‚ÄòCreate/Edit Stack‚Äô. When you make a change within a Stack, choose ‚ÄôUpdate Selected Stacks‚Äô or ‚ÄòUpdate All Stacks‚Äô to update the layout. Pro tip: bind these to a keyboard shortcut to speed up your workflow.

Stack parameters:
* Spacing: The amount of space separating layers.
* Direction: Whether layers should be stacked horizontally or vertically.
* Alignment: Whether layers should be aligned to the top, middle or bottom of their parent Frame or Component. This is optional, so layers can maintain their original alignment.
* Anchoring: The corner to which the parent container resizes relative to.

Other notes:
* Stacks can be nested inside of other Stacks.
* Stacks applied to Components also affect their instances. Instances cannot currently be overridden since Figma doesn't support overriding instance child layer positions.
* Stacks carry over to different pages/documents if the element is copied and pasted to a different 
* Feature requests welcome :)

Roadmap:
[ ] If Figma adds support for triggering code on events, I‚Äôll add functionality to update Stacks automatically when their contents are changed.

plugins.name: Star Maker
plugins.description:
Generate rating stars for your designs in no time!
Create half star ratings or even 0.X star ratings without fiddling around to get that exact percentage.

The days are over when you had to manually create your star rating, Star Maker - Your wish has just came true ;)

plugins.name: Stark
plugins.description:
Design products that are accessible, ethical, and inclusive with a contrast checker, colorblind simulator, education and more. All based on WCAG guidelines.

‚Äã

How it works

Contrast Checker

We think about our color contrast checker like a stack of pancakes, and there are a few combos you can use when checking contrast...

‚Äã

‚Ä¢ Shape Layer + Shape Layer

‚Ä¢ Text Layer + Shape Layer

‚Ä¢ Text Layer + Text Layer (Odd combo though, tbh)

‚Ä¢ Component or Instance (this checks against the #frame)

‚Ä¢ Single Layer (this checks against the #frame)

‚Äã

To run the contrast check...

1. Select one of the options above

2. Run the check from the plugin menu by going to Plugins > Stark > Contrast Checker.

‚Äã

Something to note:

Want to check contrast on an opaque layer? No problem! Turn the fill, text or layer opacity of your foreground element to `< 100%`, and voila. Opaque and bake!

‚Äã

But don't try to run the checker on any gradients or imagery ‚Äî it won't work as we don't allow it right now. Why? Well, you get into finicky territory because you can't guarantee with certainty the RGB/HEX/etc. value so your ratio may actually be a false positive. Once we have the perfect solution, we‚Äôll deliver.

‚Äã

Colorblind Simulator

The colorblind simulator allows you to simulate what your designs would look like for individuals with various types of colorblindness. While your designs may pass contrast as is (Great job!), it actually may look completely different and have drastically different contrast depending on the colorblindness.

‚Äã

To run the simulator‚Ä¶

1. Select a #frame

2. Run the simulation from the plugin menu by going to Plugins > Stark > Colorblind Simulator

3. Select the colorblindness type to simulate

plugins.name: Static Localizer
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to localize your content using a static dictionary.

Unlike many other localization plugins, it
- gracefully handles mixed text formatting
- correctly renders RTL texts
- can perform currency conversion
- can perform font substitution

Usage: https://github.com/thoughteer/figma-static-localizer#usage

plugins.name: Status ‚úÖ
plugins.description:
When collaborating on features with multiple designers and developers, it can be hard to keep track of which designs are ready to be implemented and what is still a work in progress.

Status for Figma brings order to the chaos by providing a simple way to mark the status of a design. Simple right-click on your frame, go to Plugins, Status, and select your desired status.

Some tips:
- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.
- Use the keyboard shortcut to quickly set a status: hit `cmd /` in Mac and `ctrl /` on Windows, type a Status (e.g. ‚ÄúDone‚Äù) and hit return.
- Status for Figma is not limited to frames. It works with any object you can select.
- You can optionally automatically group the selected element and status badge, so they can be moved around easily (see the plugin settings)

Status for Figma is open source. Feel free to contribute or to send suggestions. https://github.com/bramschulting/status-for-figma

plugins.name: Status Annotations
plugins.description:
Quickly indicate the status of your designes when collaborating with your team.

How to use:
1. Launch the plugin
2. Select some frames, choose the status you want

If you move frames around and they get disorganized from their labels. Simple relaunch the plugin, or use the plugin relaunch button on the sidebar.

Roadmap:
‚Äì Potentially adding support to tag nested frames

plugins.name: Step by stepper
plugins.description:
Create stepper components easily.

Choose the number of steps, the size of each circle, the direction, the space between the elements and more.

plugins.name: Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
Leave notes in your Figma file

You can insert notes one at time by selecting a note colour.

When you run the plugin you can add notes in the following colours: green, red, purple, blue, white, and classic yellow!

----------------
Paste into note
----------------
If you have text that you would like to paste into your file just select "Paste into note" and your text will be added in a yellow note.

Multiple notes can be created when you paste text that has line breaks in it. This makes adding a collection of notes faster from your favourite text editor and/or spreadsheet.

You can also replace text of an existing note by pasting text when you have that note selected. This also works for inserting multiple notes of a specific colour.

---------------
Change colours
---------------
Change the colour of an existing note to another one in the palette by using the "Change colour" command

plugins.name: Stories by Freepik
plugins.description:
Cool illustrations to power up your project!

Stories is the latest creation from Freepik, one of the main references in the free graphic resources market. Thousands of illustrated concepts, with editable colors and backgrounds, are available for download. All of them come in different styles, and can be animated too with the online editor. Visit Stories by Freepik and get started!


This plugin allows you to search for illustrations from Stories by Freepik‚Äôs database and insert them directly into your project. You can choose the style of the illustration, its global color and what kind of background you want to have. All in a few clicks!


Instructions:

1. Run the Stories by Freepik plugin.

2. Use the search bar to find an illustrated concept.

3. Filter the results by style and then choose the desired color and background.

4. Click the illustration to add it to your project and start editing!
